src: تأكد من إنو إيدك مرتخية قد ما فيك مع الاستمرار بضرب كل النغمات بشكل صحيح، جرب كمان ما تحرك أصابعك بطريقة غريبة. بهالطريقة حتتعب بأقل شكل ممكن. وتذكر دايما إنه ما في داعي للضغط على المفاتيح بقوة كبيرة للحصول على صوت إضافي متل البيانو. لتحصل على صوت إضافي على الأكورديون، فيك تستعمل المنفاخ بضغط أو سرعة أكبر.
mt: Make sure your fingers are relaxed and keep striking the notes correctly, try moving your fingers in a strange way. This will tire you in the least possible way. And remember that there is no need to press the keys with a lot of force to get an additional sound like a piano. To get an additional sound on the accordion, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: وحدة من أكتر المشكال الشائعة لما تجرب تحول فيلم لصيغة الدي في دي هيي المسح الزايد. معظم أجهزة التلفزيون بتنصنع بطريقة بترضي عامة الناس. لهيدا السبب، كل شي بتشوفه على التلفزيون تم قصه من فوق وتحت والجانبين. وانعمل هيدا الشي للتأكد من إنو الصورة بتغطي الشاشة بأكملها. ومنسمي هيدا الشي بالمسح الضوئي الزايد. للأسف لما تشغل الدي في دي من المرجح تكون حدود الشاشة مقطوشة. وإذا كان الفيديو بيحتوي على ترجمات قريبة ما رح تظهر كاملة.
mt: 1. A common problem with converting a movie to DVD format is overscan. Most TVs are manufactured to appeal to the general public. For this reason, everything you see on the TV has been cropped from the top and bottom and the sides. We do this to ensure that the image covers the entire screen. Unfortunately, when you play a DVD, the edges of the screen are likely to be cut off. And if the video contains subtitles, they may not be fully visible.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: وحدة من أكتر المشكال الشائعة لما تجرب تحول فيلم لصيغة الدي في دي هيي المسح الزايد. معظم أجهزة التلفزيون بتنصنع بطريقة بترضي عامة الناس. لهيدا السبب، كل شي بتشوفه على التلفزيون تم قصه من فوق وتحت والجانبين. وانعمل هيدا الشي للتأكد من إنو الصورة بتغطي الشاشة بأكملها. ومنسمي هيدا الشي بالمسح الضوئي الزايد. للأسف لما تشغل الدي في دي من المرجح تكون حدود الشاشة مقطوشة. وإذا كان الفيديو بيحتوي على ترجمات قريبة ما رح تظهر كاملة.

For this reason, everything you see on the TV has been cropped from the top and bottom and the sides. We do this to ensure that the image covers the entire screen. Unfortunately, when you play a DVD, the edges of the screen are likely to be cut off. And if the video contains subtitles, they may not be fully visible.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: اعتُمِدِت الخطة الأمريكية لشن هجمات منسقة من تلات اتجاهات مختلفة. رح يشن الجنرال جون كادوالدر هجوم مضلل ضد الموقع العسكري البريطاني ببوردنتاون، كرمال منع أي تعزيزات. رح ياخد الجنرال جيمس إيوينج 700 مليشيا عبر النهر بترينتون فيري، ويستولي على الجسر فوق نهر أسونبينك ويمنع أي قوات معادية من الهروب. كانت القوة الهجومية الرئيسية المكونة من 2400 رجل تعبر النهر تسعة أميال شمال ترينتون، من بعدها بتنقسم لمجموعتين، وحدة تحت قيادة جرين ووحدة تحت قيادة سوليفان، كرمال شن هجوم قبل بزوغ الفجر.
mt: The American plan was to launch coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalader would lead a diversionary attack against the British military site at Bordentown, preventing any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militiamen across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy forces from escaping. The main attacking force, consisting of 2400 men, would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, then split into two groups, one under the command of Greene and one under the command of Sullivan, and launch the attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "بعد اعتماده من قبل الكونجرس بـ 4 تموز، مسودة مكتوبة بخط اليد وقعها رئيس الكونجرس جون هانكوك والوزير تشارلز طومسون تم ارسالها على بعد بعض البنايات من مطبعة جون دنلاب. وخلال الليل تم عمل ما بين 150 و 200 نسخة، تعرف اليوم باسم ""Dunlap Broadsides."" كانت القراية العامة الأولى للوثيقة من قبل جون نيكسون بساحة قاعة الاستقلال بــ 8 تموز. انبعتت نسخة لجورج واشنطن بـ6 تموز وقراها لقواتو بنيويورك بـ9 تموز. وصلت نسخة على لندن بـ10 آب. ملصقات (The 25 Dunlap) بعدها موجودة وهي أقدم نسخ من الوثيقة موجودة من عدا النسخة الأصلية المكتوبة بخط اليد."
mt: 4 July, after its approval by Congress, a handwritten draft signed by John Hancock and Charles Thomson was sent to the John Dunlap print shop a few buildings away. During the night, between 150 and 200 copies were made, known today as "Dunlap Broadsides." The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in front of Independence Hall on 8 July. A copy was sent to George Washington on 6 July and read to the New York militia on 9 July. A copy arrived in London on 10 August. The 25 Dunlap Broadsides are the oldest surviving copies of the document other than the original handwritten draft.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: وطالب المستعمرين بتعزيزات، بعد ما شافوا هيدا النشاط. تضمنت القوات اللي عززت المواقع الأمامية كل من فوج نيوهامبشاير الأول والتالت المكون من 200 رجل، تحت قيادة العقيد جون ستارك وجيمس ريد (صار كل واحد منهم جنرالات). أخد رجال ستارك مواقعهن على طول السياج على الطرف الشمالي لموقع المستعمر. لما فتح المد المنخفض حفرة على طول نهر المستيك بالشمال الشرقي من شبه الجزيرة ، بسرعة وسعوا السياج بجدار حجري قصير للشمال بيخلص عند حافة المي على شط صغير. حط جريدلي أو ستارك عصى على بعد 100 قدم (30 متر) تقريباً قدّام السياج وأمر ما يطلق حدا النار لحد ما يقطعوه الزباين.
mt: The settlers demanded reinforcements after seeing this activity. The forces that strengthened the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire Regiments, each of 200 men, under the command of Colonel John Stark and James Reed (both of whom later became generals). Stark's men took their positions along the fence on the northern end of the settlement. When the low gate opened along the Muskeg River in the northeastern part of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north, ending at the edge of the bay on a small beach. Stark's men placed poles about 100 feet (30 m) apart in front of the fence and ordered a volley to be fired until the enemy was driven back.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: الصين القديمة كان عندها طريقة فريدة لإظهار فترات زمنية مختلفة؛ كل مرحلة من مراحل الصين أو كل عيلة كانت بالسلطة كانت سلالة مميزة. كمان بين كل سلالة وسلاسة كان فيه عصر غير مستقر للمقاطعات المقسمة. أشهر هيدي الفترات كانت حقبة الممالك التلاتة يلّي بقيت 60 سنة بين عيلة هان وسلالة جين. بهيدي الفترات، اندلعت حرب شرسة بين عدة نبلاء يلّي قاتلوا كرمال العرش. كانت الممالك التلاتة واحدة من أكتر العصور الدموية بتاريخ الصين القديمة، مات الآلاف من الناس بسبب الصراع على أعلى كرسي بالقصر الكبير بشيان.
mt: China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each dynasty or ruling family was a distinct lineage. Between each dynasty and dynasty, there was an unstable period of divided provinces. The most famous of these periods was the Three Kingdoms, which lasted 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. During these periods, a fierce war broke out between several nobles who fought for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest periods in the history of ancient China, with thousands of people dying in the struggle for the highest seat in the Great Palace in Xian.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: جيش ومستعمرات النمل بيمشي وبعشش بمراحل مختلفة كمان. بالمرحلة البدوية، بيمشوا نمل الجيش بالليل وبوقفوا تيخيموا بالنهار. بتبلِّش المستعمرة بمرحلة الترحال لمّا يقل الأكل المتوفر، وخلال هيدي المرحلة، بتعمل المستعمرة أعشاش مؤقتة بتتغير كل يوم. تستمر كل من هيدي الاقتحامات أو المسيرات البدوية لمدة 17 يوم تقريباً.
mt: Army and ant colonies march and build in different stages. In the nomadic stage, the army ants march at night and stop to build their nest during the day. The colony builds temporary nests when food is scarce, and during the migratory stage, the colony builds new nests every day. Both the raids and nomadic stages last about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: بتعتمد العديد من الإيقاعات المرصودة بعلم وظايف الأعضاء والسلوك كتير على وجود دورات داخلية وإنتاجها من خلال الساعات البيولوجية. الإيقاعات الدورية اللي منها مجرد استجابات للإشارات الدورية الخارجية تم توثيقها لمعظم الكائنات الحية، بما فيها البكتيريا والفطريات والنباتات والحيوانات. الساعات البيولوجية هي مذبذبات ذاتية الاستدامة يلّي بتستمر لفترة تدوير حرة حتى بحالة عدم وجود إشارات خارجية.
mt: Many circadian rhythms are based on the presence of internal oscillators and their production through biological clocks. Circadian rhythms that are merely responses to external periodic signals have been documented in most living organisms, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self-sustaining oscillations that continue for a period of free-running time even in the absence of external signals.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: السكان هم مجموعة الكائنات الحية من نوع معين بقلب منطقة جغرافية معينة. لما كل الأشخاص بمجتمع ما يكونوا متطابقين بصفة نمطية معينة بتم تسميتهم بمونومورف (أحادي الشكل). ولما يظهر الأشخاص عدة متغيرات لصفة معينة بتم تسميتهم ببوليمورفيم (متعدد الأشكال).
mt: A population is a group of individuals of the same species living in a particular geographic area. When all the individuals in a society are similar in a particular way, they are called monomorphic (single form). When individuals in a society show several variations in a particular way, they are called polymorphic (multiple forms).
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: بتجذب سياحة طبيعة الأشخاص المهتمين بزيارة المناطق الطبيعية للاستمتاع بالمناظر الطبيعية، بما فيها الحياة البرية النباتية والحيوانية. تشمبتضمنل الأمثلة على الأنشطة بالموقع الصيد وصيد السمك والتصوير الفوتوغرافي ومراقبة الطيور وزيارة الحدايق ودراسة المعلومات عن النظام البيئي. مثال عن هيدا، هو زيارة حيوانات الأورانج أوتان وتصويرها والتعرف عليها ببورنيو.
mt: Nature tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas to enjoy the scenery, including the flora and fauna. Examples of activities at the site include hunting, fishing, photography, birdwatching, visiting gardens, and studying the environment. An example of this is visiting orangutans and photographing and learning about them in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: كل صباح، بيتركوا الناس البلدات الصغيرة بالسيارات ليروحوا لأماكن شغلهم وبيمرقوا من حد ناس بتكون وجهة شغلهم بالمحل يلّي بعدهم فالين منه. بمكوك النقل الديناميكي هيدا، الكل مرتبط بطريقة ما بنظام نقل يعتمد على السيارات الخاصة وبيدعمها. بيشير العلم هلق لإنو هيدا الاقتصاد الهائل من الكربون أزاح المحيط الحيوي من وحدة من حالاتو المستقرة اللي دعمت التطور البشري على مدار المليونين سنة الماضية.
mt: Every morning, people leave small towns in cars to go to their workplaces and then return to their homes. This dynamic transport system, in which everyone is somehow connected to a car-based transportation system, is referred to by science as a massive carbon economy that has displaced the oceanic biome from its stable state that supported human evolution over the past million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: ممكن اعتبار الذرة على انها وحدة من أساسات كل مادة. هو كيان كتير معقد بيتكون، بحسب نموذج بوهر المبسط، من نواة مركزية بتدور حول الإلكترونات، بتشبه شوي الكواكب يلّي بتدور حول الشمس - شوف الشكل 1.1. بتتكوّن النواة من جسيمين - نيوترونات وبروتونات. البروتونات إلها شحنة كهربائية موجبة بينما النيوترونات ما لها شحنة. الإلكترونات إلها شحنة كهربائية سالبة.
mt: 1.1: The atom is a complex unit that, according to the simplified Bohr model, consists of a central nucleus that orbits electrons, somewhat like planets orbiting the sun. The nucleus is made of neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, while neutrons have none. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: بتعتمد كل أجهزة الكمبيوتر المستمعلة اليوم تقريبًا على معالجة المعلومات المشفرة بشكل أرقام ثنائية. ممكن يتضمن الرقم الثنائي على قيمة واحدة بس من قيمتين، يعني 0 أو 1، وهيدي الأرقام تُسمى أرقام ثنائية - أو بت، لاستعمال لغة الكمبيوتر.
mt: 99% of all computers today rely on binary processing, meaning that each bit can only have one value out of two, 0 or 1. These values are called bits, for short.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: بتعتمد كل أجهزة الكمبيوتر المستمعلة اليوم تقريبًا على معالجة المعلومات المشفرة بشكل أرقام ثنائية. ممكن يتضمن الرقم الثنائي على قيمة واحدة بس من قيمتين، يعني 0 أو 1، وهيدي الأرقام تُسمى أرقام ثنائية - أو بت، لاستعمال لغة الكمبيوتر.

src: "يمكن أن تساعد المدونات كمان بتحسين كتابة التلاميذ. بينما ببلش التلميذ بكتير من الأوقات مدونتهم بقواعد نحوية وإملائية سيئة، فوجود الجمهور بغير هيدا الشي عمومًا. لإنو التلاميذ غالبًا ما بيكونو الجمهور الأكتر انتقاد، بيبلش كاتب المدونة بالسعي لتحسين الكتابة لتجنب النقد. كمان التدوين ""بيجبر التلاميذ أن يصيروا أكتر ذكاء بخصوص العالم من حولهم."" الحاجة لتغذية اهتمام الجمهور بتلهم التلاميذ ليكونوا أذكيا ومثيرين للاهتمام (توتو، 2004). التدوين وسيلة بتزيد التعاون وبتشجع التلاميذ على توسيع نطاق التعلم لأكتر من اليوم الدراسي التقليدي. الاستعمال المناسب للمدونات ""ممكن أن يخلّي التلاميذ يصيروا أكتر تحليلاً ونقدًا؛ من خلال الاستجابة الفعالة لمواد الإنترنت، ممكن أ يححدوا التلاميذ مواقفهم بسياق كتابات غير أشخاص وكمان تحديد وجهات نظرهم الخاصة بخصوص قضايا معينة ( Oravec ، 2002)."
mt: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often write their blogs with poor grammatical and syntactical rules, the presence of an audience in general. Because students are often the most critical audience, the blogger seeks to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""encourages students to become more intelligent about the world around them."" The need to feed the audience's interest inspires students to be more intelligent and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a way to increase collaboration and encourage students to expand their learning beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can help students become more analytical and critical; by responding effectively to Internet materials, students can develop their positions in the context of writings by others and also identify their own positions on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: بشجع الاتصال غير المتزامن الوقت للتفكير ورد الفعل تجاه الغير. بتعطي التلاميذ قدرة على العمل بحسب سرعتهم الخاصة والتحكم بوتيرة المعلومات التعليمية. بالإضافة لهيدا الشي، هناك قيود زمنية أقل مع احتمال تكون ساعات العمل مرنة. (بريمر ، 1998) بيسمح استعمال الإنترنت وشبكة الويب العالمية للمتعلمين إنهم يوصلوا للمعلومات بكل الأوقات. التلاميذ بيقدروا يبعتوا رسايل للمدرسين بأي وقت من اليوم ويتوقعوا إجابات سريعة، بدل من أن ينطروا الاجتماع التالي وج لوج.
mt: Asynchronous communication allows for thinking and responding to others. It gives students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of educational information. In addition to this, there are fewer time constraints with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Pimmer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows students to access information at any time. Students can send messages to teachers at any time of the day and expect quick responses, instead of waiting for the next class and logging in.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: ولطالما ألهمت القلعة التقليدية بالعصور الوسطى الخيال، واستحضرت صور المبارزات والعزومات وفروسية آرثر. حتى عند الوقوف بين أطلال عمرها ألف سنة، من السهل تذكر أصوات وروائح المعارك يلّي خلصت من فترة طويلة، وعلى وشك تسمع قعقعة الحوافر على البحص وتشم ريحة الخوف المتزايد من حفر الأبراج المحصنة. بس هل خيالنا مبني على الواقع؟ ليش تم بناء القلاع أساساً؟ كيف تم تصميمها وبناؤها؟
mt: The traditional castle of the Middle Ages has always inspired fantasy, conjuring up images of knights and tombs and chivalry of Arthur. Even when standing among ruins a thousand years old, it is easy to remember the sounds and smells of battles that ended long ago, and soon to hear the clatter of hooves on the drawbridge and smell the fear of the besieged castle. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: بتعبر قلعة Kirby Muxloe بيت محصن أكتر من كونها قلعة حقيقية بهيديك الوقت. ما كانت شبابيكه الإزاز الكبيرة وحيطانه الرقيقة قادرة على مقاومة هجوم ثابت لفترة طويلة. بالتمانينيات من القرن التسعتعش بس بلّش اللورد هاستينغز بتعميرو، كانت البلد مسالمة نوعاً ما وكان الدفاع مطلوب بس ضد مجموعات صغيرة من اللصوص المتجولين.
mt: Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified manor house than a true castle at this time. Its large, narrow windows and thin walls were capable of withstanding a prolonged siege by a small group of bandits.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: مع التغيير من ربع ميل لنص ميل، بتصير السرعة أقل أهمية وبصير التحمل ضرورة أساسية. عدّاء النصف ميل من الدرجة الأولى اللي بيقدر يخلص السباق بأقل من دقيقتين، أكيد لازم يكون كتير سريع، بس لازم يحسّن القدرة على التحمل بكل المخاطر. شوية ركض عبر الضاحية بفصل الشتا مع تمارين بالجيم للجزء الفوقاني من الجسم، هو أفضل تحضير لموسم الركض.
mt: 1/4 mile to 1/2 mile, speed becomes less important and endurance becomes a basic necessity. A first-class half-miler who can finish a race in less than two minutes is certainly fast, but he must also improve his endurance with all the risks. A few runs through the suburbs with winter breaks and gym workouts for the upper part of the body are the best preparation for the running season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: ما بتقدر لممارسات الغذائية السليمة وحدها تولد أداء متميز، بس يمكن تأثر بشكل كبير على صحة الرياضيين الشباب بشكل عام. الحفاظ على توازن طاقة صحي وممارسة عادات الترطيب الفعالة وفهم الجوانب المختلفة لممارسات المكملات ممكن يساعد الرياضيين على تحسين أدائهم وزيادة استمتاعهم بالرياضة.
mt: While optimal nutrition practices alone cannot produce superior performance, they can have a significant impact on the health of young athletes in general. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplement practices can help athletes improve their performance and enjoy their sport more.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: يعتبر الركض لمسافات متوسطة رياضة غير مكلفة نسبيًا. ومع هيك، في كتير مفاهيم غلط بتتعلق بالمعدات القليلة المطلوبة للمشاركة. فيكن تشترو المنتجات حسب الحاجة، بس معظمها رح يكون إلو تأثير زغير أو ما رح يكون إلو تأثير حقيقي على الأداء. ممكن يحس الرياضيين أنهم بفضلوا منتج معين حتى لو ما عنده فوائد حقيقية.
mt: Running long distances is a relatively inexpensive sport. However, there are many misconceptions about the equipment needed to participate. Buy what you need, but most of it will have little or no real effect on performance. Athletes may feel they are benefiting from a certain product even if it has no real benefits.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: "بيعتمد التصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي على ظاهرة فيزيائية اسمها الرنين المغناطيسي النووي اكتشفها بالتلاتينات فيليكس بلوك (اللي بيشتغل بجامعة ستانفورد) وإدوارد بورسيل (من جامعة هارفارد). بهيدا الصدى، المجال المغناطيسي وموجات الراديو بسببوا إطلاق الذرات لإشارات راديو دقيقة. سنة 1970، اكتشف الطبيب وعالم الأبحاث ريموند داماديان أسس استعمال التصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي كأداة للتشخيص الطبي. بعد أربع سنين تم منح براءة اختراع، ويلّي كانت أول براءة اختراع بالعالم تصدر بمجال التصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي. سنة 1977، كمَّل الدكتور داماديان بناء أول جهاز تصوير بالرنين المغناطيسي ""لكامل الجسم""، ويلّي عطوه اسم ""Indomitable""."
mt: "Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is based on a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance, discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (who worked at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). This resonance, the magnetic field, and radio waves caused the nuclei of atoms to emit tiny radio signals. In 1970, physician and researcher Raymond Damadian founded the use of MRI as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, he was granted a patent, the first patent in the world for MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first "whole-body" MRI scanner, which he named "Indomitable". "
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: البشر هنّي لحد كبير أكتر كائنات عندهم موهبة بقراية عقول التانيين هيدا بيعني أنّو نحنا قادرين بشكل ناجح انّو نتنبأ بادراك غير أشخاص شو بيقصدوا أو بشو هنّي مؤمنين أو شو بيعرفوا أو بشو بيرغبوا. من بين هيدي القدرات، تعتبر قدرة فهم نية الأشخاص التانيين شي كتير مهم. بتسمح لنا بحل الغموض المحتمل بالحركات الجسدية. مثلاً، إذا شفت شخص عم يكسر شبّاك سيارة، فمن المحتمل أن تفترض أنه كان عم يجرِّب يسرق سيارة شخص غريب. كان رح يُحاكم بشكل مختلف لو كان مضيّع مفاتيح سيارته وكانت سيارته يلّي كان عم يحاول يقتحمها.
mt: Humans are, to a large extent, capable of reading minds. This means that we are able to successfully predict what other people are thinking, believing, or intending. Among these abilities, the ability to understand other people's intentions is particularly important. It allows us to resolve ambiguity in their bodily movements. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you might assume that he was trying to steal a car from a stranger. He would have been treated differently if he had lost his car keys and was trying to break into his own car.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: على الرغم من أن للذكاء الاصطناعي دلالة قوية على الخيال العلمي، فإن الذكاء الاصطناعي بيشكل فرع مهم كتير من علوم الكمبيوتر، وبيتعامل مع السلوك والتعلم والتكيف الذكي بالآلة. بيتضمن البحث بالذكا الاصطناعي صنع الآلات لأتمتة المهمات اللي بتتطلب سلوك ذكي. بتشمل الأمثلة التحكم والتخطيط والجدولة والقدرة على الإجابة على تشخيصات العملاء وأسئلتهم، بالإضافة للتعرف على خط اليد والصوت والوجه. صارت هيدي الأشيا تخصصات منفصلة، وبتركّز على تقديم حلول لمشاكل الحياة الحقيقية. غالبًا بيستعملو نظام الذكا الاصطناعي حاليًا بمجالات الاقتصاد والطب والهندسة والجيش، كمان تم بناؤه بعدة تطبيقات برامج الكمبيوتر وألعاب الفيديو المنزلية.
mt: Although artificial intelligence has a strong association with science fiction, artificial intelligence is a major branch of computer science, dealing with the simulation of intelligent behavior in machines. The field was founded on the belief that, given the right kind of intelligent behavior, it would be possible to imitate it with a suitably sophisticated machine. Examples of such behavior include learning, reasoning, and problem solving. ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: أنماط التفكير التقاربي هي تقنيات لحل المشكلات بتوحد الأفكار أو المجالات المختلفة لإيجاد حل. بتركز هيدي العقلية على السرعة والمنطق والدقة، وكمان تحديد الحقايق وإعادة تطبيق التقنيات الحالية وجمع المعلومات. العامل الأهم بهيدي العقلية هو إنّو في إجابة وحدة صحيحة، وأنت بتفكر بالجوابين الصح والغلط. بيرتبط هيدا النوع من التفكير بعلم محدد أو تدابير معيارية. الأشخاص اللي بيفكرو بهالطريقة عندن تفكير منطقي وبيقدرو يحفظو الأنماط ويحلّو المشاكل ويشتغلو على الاختبارات العلمية.
mt: Problem solving is a technique for solving problems by combining different ideas or fields to find a solution. It focuses on speed, logic, and accuracy, as well as identifying facts and reapplying current techniques and gathering information. The most important factor in this type of thinking is that in answering a correct unit, you are thinking of the correct and wrong answers. This type of thinking is related to a specific science or standardized procedures. People who think in this way have logical thinking and can remember patterns and solve problems and work on scientific experiments.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: "حقق استعمال تسجيل الفيديو اكتشافات مهمة بتفسير التعبيرات الدقيقة وحركات الوجه اللي بتستمر لبضعة أجزاء من الثانية. بشكل خاص، بقولوا أن ممكن الشخص يكتشف إذا كان الشخص عم يكذب من خلال تفسير التعبيرات الدقيقة بشكل صحيح. شرح أوليفر ساكس بمقالتو ""خطاب الرئيس'' كيف إنو الأشخاص اللي ما بيقدرو يفهمو الحكي بسبب تلف الدماغ، بيقدرو يقيمو الصدق بدقة. حتى اقترح أن متل هيدي القدرات بتفسير السلوك البشري ممكن تكون مشتركة مع حيوانات متل الكلاب الأليفة."
mt: "Video analysis has revealed important findings in interpreting subtle expressions and facial movements that last for a few fractions of a second. In particular, they say that people who are unable to understand speech due to brain damage can accurately detect truthfulness by interpreting subtle expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks in his article "The President's Speech" suggested that the abilities to interpret human behavior may be shared with animals such as domestic dogs."
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: أن القدرة على تلقي المعرفة والتعلم تغيرت بالطريقة المذكورة فوق، فتغير المعدل الأساسي يلّي تم تلقي المعرفة فيه. كان نهج تلقي المعلومات مختلف. بطَّل الضغط القائم داخل السحب الفردي موجود، بس القدرة على استرداد النص صارت أكتر تركيزا. أساساً ، عمل عصر النهضة تغيير كبير بنهج التعلم ونشر المعرفة.
mt: The ability to receive knowledge and learning has changed in the way described above, so the basic rate has changed, allowing knowledge to be received in it. The approach to receiving information was different. The pressure inside the individual bubble was reduced, but the ability to recover the text became more focused. Basically, the Renaissance made a major change in the learning approach and the dissemination of knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: "بيجمع الإنترنت بين عناصر الاتصال الجماهيري والشخصي. بتأدّي الخصائص المميزة للإنترنت لأبعاد إضافية من ناحية نهج الاستخدامات والإشباع. مثلاً، تم وصف ""التعلم"" و ""التنشئة الاجتماعية"" كدوافع مهمة لاستعمال الإنترنت (James et al. ، 1995). تم تحديد ""المشاركة الشخصية"" و""العلاقات المستمرة"" كجوانب تحفيز جديدة بواسطة ""آيمي وماككورد 1998"" لما عملو تحقيق عن ردود فعل الجمهور على مواقع إنترنت."
mt: "The Internet combines the characteristics of mass and interpersonal communication. It performs the unique functions of the Internet in additional dimensions of use and satisfaction. For example, "learning" and "socialization" were identified as important motives for Internet use (James et al., 1995). "Personal sharing" and "continuing relationships" were identified as new motivators by "Amy and MacCord 1998" in their study of public reactions to Internet sites."
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: بلغ النمط القوطي ذروته بالفترة ما بين القرنين الـ10 والـ11 والـ14. بالبدابة تأثر اللبس بالشرق كتير بالثقافة البيزنطية. بسبب بطء قنوات الاتصال، ممكن تتأخر أساليب الحياة بالغرب بين 25 لـ 30 سنة. مع نهاية العصور الوسطى، بلّشت أوروبا الغربية تطور أسلوبها الخاص. واحدة من أكبر التطورات بهيديك الوقت الأزرار اللي بلش الناس يستعملها ليربطوا تيابهم واللي كانت نتيجة للحروب الصليبية.
mt: Gothic fashion reached its peak between the 10th and 11th and 14th centuries. In the beginning, it was influenced by Byzantine culture. Because of slow communication channels, Western fashion could lag behind Eastern fashion by 25 to 30 years. At the end of the Middle Ages, Western Europe developed its own style. One of the biggest developments was buttons, which people used to fasten their clothes, and which was a result of the Crusades.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: فينا نبلش نعيش بطريقة مفيدة للبيئة وننضم للحركة البيئية، وفينا كمان نكون نشطاء لنقلل المعاناة المستقبلية. وهيدا متل علاج العوارض بحالات كتيرة. بس إذا ما بدنا حل مؤقت لازم نحل المشكلة من شروشها. من الواضح بما فيه الكفاية أن العالم تغير كتير بسبب التقدم العلمي والتكنولوجي للبشر، وصارت المشاكل أكبر بسبب الزيادة السكانية ونمط الحياة المبذر للبشرية.
mt: 1. We can live in a way that is beneficial to the environment and join the environmental movement, and we can also be active in reducing future suffering. This is like treating symptoms in many cases. But if we want a temporary solution, we need to solve the problem from its roots. It is clear enough that the world has changed a lot due to human scientific and technological progress, and the problems have become bigger due to population growth and the wasteful lifestyle of humanity.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: توازن القوى كان نظام عم تسعى فيه الدول الأوروبية للحفاظ على السيادة الوطنية لكل الدول الأوروبية. كان المفهوم هو أنّو لازم كل الدول الأوروبية تسعى لمنع دولة وحدة تصير قوية، وبالتالي الحكومات الوطنية غالبا ما غيرت تحالفاتها كرمال الحفاظ على التوازن. كانت حرب الخلافة الإسبانية أول حرب بتكون قضيتها المركزية هي ميزان القوى. كان بمثابة تغيير مهم، بما إنو القوى الأوروبية بطّل عندها حجة الحروب الدينية. وهيك، بتكون حرب التلاتين سنة آخر حرب بتنوصف بأنها حرب دينية.
mt: The Balance of Power was a system in which European states sought to preserve the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European states should seek to prevent a single state from becoming too powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances to preserve the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first war to have a central issue of the balance of power. It was a major change, as European powers ceased to have a justification for religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War was the last war to be described as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: خلال هيدي الفترة من التاريخ الأوروبي، خضعت الكنيسة الكاثوليكية، يلّي صارت غنية وقوية، للفحص الدقيق. لأكتر من ألف سنة، ربط الدين المسيحي الدول الأوروبية ببعضها البعض على الرغم من الاختلافات باللغة والعادات. أثرت قوتها الشاملة على الكل من الملك لعامة الناس. واحد من المبادئ الرئيسية للمسيحية هو إنو لازم استعمال الثروة للتخفيف من المعاناة والفقر وإنو المصاري النقدية للكنيسة موجودة خصيصًا لهيدا السبب. من أكتر من ألف سنة، كانت السلطة المركزية للكنيسة بروما، ودفع هيدا التركيز على سلطة والمصاري، كتير أشخاص للتساؤل عن إذا كان عم بتم تلبية هيدي العقيدة.
mt: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which became rich and powerful, underwent a rigorous examination. For more than a thousand years, Christianity bound European nations together despite linguistic and cultural differences. Its pervasive influence affected everyone from kings to commoners. One of the main principles of Christianity is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty, and that the Church's monetary resources are specifically for this purpose. For more than a thousand years, the central authority of the Church was in Rome, and this focus on power and money led many people to question whether this was actually fulfilling the doctrine.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: الملك لويس الستعش والملكة ماري أنطوانيت وطفليهما الصغار ماري تيريز يلّي عمرن 11 سنة ولويس تشارلز يلّي عمرو أربع سنين واخت الملك السيدة إليزابيث، بستة تشرين الاول سنة 1789، نجبروا مرعوبين على الرجوع لباريس من فرساي من قبل حشد من الغوغاء من نساء السوق. سافروا بعربية راجعين على باريس بين عدد كتير كبيرر الناس عم يصرخوا ويهتفوا ضد الملك والملكة. أجبر الغوغاء الملك والملكة على فتح شبابيك عرباتهم على مصراعيها. بوقت من الأوقات لوح واحد من أفراد العصابة براس واحد من الحرس الملكي يلّي قُتل بفرساي قدّام الملكة المرعوبة.
mt: 6 October 1789, King Louis XVI and Queen Marie Antoinette and their young children Marie Thérèse, aged 11, and Louis Charles, aged four, and the king's sister, Princess Elizabeth, were forced to return to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. They travelled in a carriage drawn by postilions, amid a large crowd of people shouting and cheering against the king and queen. The mob forced the king and queen to open the windows of their carriage. At one point, a member of the mob held up a stick against the face of a royal guard, who was killed at Versailles in front of the terrified queen.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: بعد فترة قصيرة من اندلاع الأعمال العدائية، بلَّشت بريطانيا حصارا البحري على ألمانيا. أثبتت الاستراتيجية فعاليتها، لأن قطعت الإمدادات العسكرية والمدنية الحيوية، على الرغم من أنّو هيدا الحصار انتهك القانون الدولي المقبول عمومًا يلّي تم تدوينه بعدة اتفاقيات دولية بالقرنين الماضيين. قامت بريطانيا بتلغيم المي الدولية لمنع أي سفن من الفوتة على أقسام كاملة من المحيط، يلّي شكَّل خطر حتى على السفن المحايدة. نظرًا لوجود استجابة محدودة لهيدا التكتيك، توقعت ألمانيا رد مشابه على حرب الغواصات غير المقيدة.
mt: After a short period of hostilities, Britain imposed a naval blockade on Germany. The strategy proved effective, as it cut off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated the generally accepted international law, which was codified in several international treaties in the previous two centuries. Britain declared contraband of war, prohibiting any ships from entering entire sections of the ocean, which posed a threat even to neutral ships. Due to the limited response to this tactic, Germany responded with a similar submarine warfare.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: بكل أنحاء الولايات المتحدة الأمريكية، في تقريباً 400000 حالة معروفة من مرض التصلب العصبي المتعدد (MS)، يلّي بخليه المرض العصبي الرئيسي عند البالغين الشباب ومتوسطي العمر. مرض التصلب العصبي المتعدد هو مرض بيصيب الجهاز العصبي المركزي، واللي بيتكون من الدماغ والحبل الشوكي والعصب البصري. توصلت الأبحاث لإنو الإناث أكتر عرضة للإصابة بمرض التصلب العصبي المتعدد مرتين أكتر من الذكور.
mt: 400,000 known cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) in the United States, the leading neurological disease among young and middle-aged adults. Multiple sclerosis is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which consists of the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerve. Research has shown that women are twice as likely to be affected by multiple sclerosis as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: ولاقت الدراسة أن الاكتئاب والخوف بتوسط العلاقة بين الألم والعجز عند يلّي عم بعانوا من آلام أسفل الضهر. بس آثار الكارثة ومش الاكتئاب والخوف كانت مشروطة بجلسات نشاط مبرمجة أسبوعية منتظمة. احتاج المشاركين بالنشاط المنتظم لمزيد من الدعم بخصوص المعرفة السلبية للوجع حتى يميزوا بين الوجع المزمن وتعب الجسم الطبيعي.
mt: The study found that depression and fear mediated the relationship between pain and disability in those who experienced low back pain. However, the effects of the disaster and not depression and fear were moderated by weekly, regular, active coping sessions. Participants in regular active coping needed more support regarding negative knowledge of pain to distinguish between chronic pain and normal bodily fatigue.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: بتم لعب رياضة المبارزة الحديثة على عدة مستويات، من اللاميذ يلّي عم يتعلموا بالجامعة للمنافسة المهنية والأولمبية. بتم لعب هيدي الرياضة بشكل أساسي على شكل مبارزة، فبيتنافس واحد من المبارزين مع التاني.
mt: Fencing is played on several levels, from the amateur level where people learn in universities to compete professionally and at the Olympic level. It is played primarily as a duel, where one fencer competes against another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: ممكن ما سكون التسمم الداخلي واضح دغري. الأعراض، متل الاستفراغ هي كتير عامة منهيك كا بيقدر يصير في تشخيص فوري. أفضل مؤشر للتسمم الداخلي ممكن إنّو يكون وجود علبة دوا أو علبة منظّف كيميائي مفتوحة. راجع من الملصق لمعرفة تعليمات الإسعافات الأولية المحددة لهيدا السم المحدد.
mt: It is possible that the poisoning is obvious right away. The symptoms, such as vomiting, are very general and can be diagnosed immediately. The best indicator of poisoning is the presence of a medicine or chemical cleaning container open. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for this specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: للتحقق من الضحية، لازم أول شي تتفقد مسرح الجريمة لضمان سلامتك. لازم تلاحظ وضعية الضحية لما تقرب منها وإذا في أي علامات حمرا تلقائية. إذا تعرضت للأذى بالوقت يلّي عم تحاول فيه المساعدة، بتكون عم تخلّي الأمور أسوأ.
mt: To check for injuries, first ensure your safety by checking the crime scene. Note the victim's position before approaching and if there are any signs of immediate danger. If you are injured while trying to help, you will make things worse.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: في كتير آثار اجتماعية وسياسية متل استعمال النظام المتري والتحول من الاستبداد للجمهورية والقومية والاعتقاد بأنّو الدولة ملك للشعب ومش لحاكم واحد. كمان بعد الثورة، كانت المهن مفتوحة لكل المتقدمين الذكور يلّي سمح لأكترهم طموح ونجاح بالنجاح. نفس الشي بينطبق على الجيش لإنو بدل ما تستند تصنيفات الجيش على الرتبة، صارت بتعتمد هلق على المقدرة العقلية. ألهمت الثورة الفرنسية كمان عدة أبناء الطبقة العاملة المضطهدة بالبلدان التانية ليبلشوا ثوراتهم الخاصة.
mt: There were many social and political consequences such as the adoption of the metric system, the transition from autocracy to republic, nationalism, and the belief that the state belongs to the people and not to one ruler. After the revolution, professions were open to all qualified males, allowing more ambitious and successful people to succeed. The same applied to the army, where instead of ranks, it was based on intelligence. The revolution also inspired many oppressed working class children in other countries to rebel.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: الكل بشارك بالمجتمع وبيستعمل أنظمة النقل. والكل تقريباً بيشتكي من أنظمة النقل. نادراً ما بتسمع بالبلدان المتقدمة مستويات مشابهة من الشكاوى بخصوص جودة المي أو الجسور يلّي بتهبط. ليش بتسبب أنظمة النقل كتير من الشكاوى وبتفشل بشكل يومي؟ هل مهندسي النقل غير كفوئيين؟ أو في شي أهم من هيك عم يصير؟
mt: Everyone uses the transportation system and everyone complains about it. Rarely do you hear in advanced countries similar levels of complaints about the quality of the roads or bridges that fall. Why does the transportation system cause so many complaints and fail daily? Are transportation engineers incompetent? Or is something more important happening?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: الكل بشارك بالمجتمع وبيستعمل أنظمة النقل. والكل تقريباً بيشتكي من أنظمة النقل. نادراً ما بتسمع بالبلدان المتقدمة مستويات مشابهة من الشكاوى بخصوص جودة المي أو الجسور يلّي بتهبط. ليش بتسبب أنظمة النقل كتير من الشكاوى وبتفشل بشكل يومي؟ هل مهندسي النقل غير كفوئيين؟ أو في شي أهم من هيك عم يصير؟

src: تدفق حركة السير هو دراسة لحركة الشوفير والسيارات الفردية بين نقطتين وتفاعلاتهم مع بعضهم. للأسف تعتبر دراسة تدفق حركة السير موضوع صعب لأنه ما فينا نتوقع تصرف الشوفير بنسبة 100٪. لحسن الحظ، بيتصرفوا السواقين بنفس الطريقة؛ وبالتالي، حركة المرور هي نوعاً ما ثابتة وممكن تقريباً احتسابها. ولتمثيل تدفق حركة السير بشكل أفضل، تم إنشاء علاقات بين الخصائص الرئيسية التلاتة: (1) التدفق ، (2) الكثافة ، و (3) السرعة. بتساعد هيدي العلاقات بتخطيط وتصميم وتشغيل مرافق الطرق.
mt: Traffic flow is a study of the movement of individual vehicles and cars between two points and their interactions with each other. Unfortunately, we cannot expect drivers to behave 100% of the time. Fortunately, drivers behave in the same way, so traffic flow is somewhat constant and can be estimated. To better represent traffic flow, three main properties were created: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help plan, design, and operate road facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: كانت تجربة هيرشي وتشيس وحدة من الاقتراحات الرئيسية بأن الحمض النووي مادة وراثية. استعمل هيرشي وتشيس العاثيات، أو الفيروسات، لزرع الحمض النووي الخاص فيهم ببكتيريا. عملوا تجربتين ليعرفوا إذا كان الحمض النووي الموجود بالكتيريا مع الفوسفور المضوي أو بروتين البكتيريا موجود مع الكبريت المضوي.
mt: The Hershey-Chase experiment was one of the main proposals that DNA is a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to transplant DNA from them to bacteria. They performed two experiments to determine whether the DNA present in bacteria with phosphorus or protein present with sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: ممكن يكون للطفرات مجموعة متنوعة من التأثيرات المختلفة بحسب نوع الطفرة، وأهمية المادة الجينية المتأثرة وإذا كانت الخلايا المصابة خلايا خط جرثومي. ممكن نقل الطفرات بخلايا الخط الجرثومي بس للولاد، بينما الطفرات بمطارح تانية فيها تسبب موت الخلايا أو السرطان.
mt: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected gene, and whether the affected cells are cancerous. Mutations in germ cells can be passed to offspring, while mutations in somatic cells can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: الظاهر أن الماعز تم تدجينها لأول مرة من 10000 سنة تقريباً بجبال زاغروس يإيران. يلّشت الثقافات والقبائل القديمة تحتفظ فيها لسهولة الوصول للحليب والشعر واللحوم والجلود. كانت الماعز المحلية تُربى عمومًا بقطعان بتتجول على التلال أو مناطق الرعي التانية، وغالبًا ما يرعى رعاة الماعز يلّي بكونوا أطفالًا أو مراهقين، متل الراعي الأكتر شهرة. وطرق الرعي هيدي بعدها مستعملة حتى اليوم.
mt: Goats were first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. The ancient cultures and tribes kept them for the ease of access to milk, wool, meat, and hides. Local goats were usually bred in herds that roamed the hills or grazing areas, and often herders were children or teenagers, like the most famous herder. Herding methods are still used today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: الجولف هي لعبة بيستعمل فيها اللاعبين مضارب لضرب الكرات بقلب الثقوب. يتم لعب تمانتعشر حفرة بالجولة العادية، عادةً ببلشوا اللاعبين من أول حفرة بالملعب وبخلّصوا بالتمانتعش. اللاعب يلّي بياخد أقل عدد من الضربات أو بيتأرجح للنادي لإكمال الدورة هو الرابح. تُلعب اللعبة على العشب، ويُقص العشب المحيط بالجورة ويطلق عليه اسم الأخضر.
mt: Golf is a sport in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. A round of 18 holes is played by the players starting at the first hole and finishing at the 18th. The player who takes the fewest strokes or whose team completes the round in the fewest strokes wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the holes is cut and called the green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: الهدف الرئيسي للعلم هو معرفة الطريقة اللي بيشغل فيها بها العالم من خلال المنهج العلمي. هيدي الطريقة ترشد معظم البحث العلمي. منّا وحدها، التجريب، والتجربة هي اختبار يستعمل لإزالة وحدة أو أكتر من الفرضيات المحتملة، وطرح الأسئلة، والمراقبة، كمان بتودي لبحث علمي.
mt: The main goal of science is to understand how the world works through the scientific method. The scientific method guides most scientific research. Only through experimentation, and experience, can a hypothesis or more be tested, questions asked, and observations made, as part of scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: بتضرب الأعاصير مساحة صغيرة مقارنة بالعواصف العنيفة إلا إنه ممكن تدمر كل شي بطريقها. بتقلع الأعاصير الأشجار وبتخزق الألواح من المباني وبترفع السيارات للسما. وأعنف 2٪ من الأعاصير بتستمر لأكتر من تلات ساعات. بتوصل سرعة هيدي العواصف الوحشية لــ 480 كم / ساعة 133 م / ث ؛ 300 ميل / س.
mt: 2% of hurricanes last more than three hours. The strongest hurricanes can reach speeds of 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: صنعوا البشر العدسات المكبرة واستعملوها من آلاف وآلاف السنين. صنعوا أول تلسكوبات حقيقية بأوروبا بأواخر القرن الـ16. استعملت هيدي التلسكوبات مزيج من عدستين كرمال تخلّي الأشيا البعيدة تبيّن أقرب وأكبر.
mt: Humans have been using magnifying glasses for thousands of years. The first real telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. Huygens used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: "كان محمد مهتم كتير بأمور بتتخطى هيدي الحياة الدنيوية. كان يتردد على مغارة انعرفت باسم ""حراء"" على جبل نور للتأمل. الكهف نفسه يلّي بقي على مر الهصور، بيعطي صورة حية كتير عن الميول الروحية لمحمد. الكهف موجود على قمة أحد جبال شمال مكة، وهو معزول تمامًا عن بقية العالم. بالواقع، مش هيّن تلاقيه أبداً حتى لو كان الشخص بيعرف بوجوده. بمجرد ما يفوت على الكهف، بصير بعزلة كاملة. مش ممكن ينشاف شي غير السما الصافية الحلوة فوقك وعدة جبال محيطة. قليل كتير من هيدا العالم في يشوفو أو يسمعو من جوات الكهف."
mt: "Muhammad was very interested in matters that transcend the worldly life. He used to visit a cave called "Hira" on Mount Nur for meditation. The cave itself has remained unchanged over the centuries, giving a very vivid picture of Muhammad's spiritual inclinations. The cave is located on top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, and is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is very difficult to find it even if the person knows of its existence. Once you enter the cave, you are completely isolated. You can only see the beautiful blue sky above you and a few mountains surrounding you. Very few people have seen or heard of this world from the depths of the cave."
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: تم بناء Wagonways بإنجلترا بوقت مبكر من القرن الستعش. على الرغم من أن العربات كانت مصنوعة بس من ألواح خشبية متوازية، إلا أنها سمحت للخيول بجرّها لتتوصل لسرعة أكبر وتسحب حمل أكبر من الطرق الأكتر وعورة بشوي باليوم. تم تقديم Crossties بوقت مبكر لتثبيت المسارات بمكانها. وانعرف تدريجياً أن المسارات بتكون أكتر فعالة إذا كان عندهم شريط من الحديد من فوق. صارت هيدي الممارسة منتشرة، إلا إنه الحديد تسبب بتآكل زيادة على الدواليب الخشب للعربات. يالنهاية، استُبدلت العجلات الخشبية بعجلات حديدية. بسنة 1767 ، تم تقديم أول سكك حديدية كاملة.
mt: Wagonways were built in England early in the 18th century. Although the wagons were made of wooden planks laid side by side, they allowed horses to pull them at greater speed and haul greater loads than the rougher and more winding roads of the day. Crossties were introduced early to hold the tracks in place. It was gradually realized that the tracks would be more effective if there was a strip of iron above them. The practice became widespread, but iron caused increased wear on the wooden wagon wheels. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first complete railway was introduced.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: كان للرومانسية عنصر كبير من الحتمية الثقافية، مستمدة من كتّاب متل غوتي وفيشتي. بسياق الرومانسية، شكلت الجغرافيا الأشخاص، ومع مرور الوقت نشأت العادات والثقافة المتعلقة بهيدي الجغرافيا، وكانت هيدي منسجمة مع مكانة المجتمع، أفضل من القوانين المفروضة بشكل تعسفي.
mt: Romanticism had a strong element of cultural determinism, derived from writers such as Goethe and Vico. In the context of romanticism, geography shaped people, and over time, customs and culture related to this geography developed, and this geography was in harmony with the status of society, better than arbitrary laws.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "الحتمية التكنولوجية مصطلح بيشمل مجموعة واسعة من الأفكار بالممارسة العملية، من دفع التكنولوجيا أو الحتمية التكنولوجية لإحساس صارم بأنّو مصير الإنسان مدفوع بمنطق أساسي مرتبط بالقوانين العلمية ومظهرها بالتكنولوجيا. بتتشارك معظم تفسيرات الحتمية التكنولوجية فكرتين عامتين: إنو تطور التكنولوجيا نفسها بيتبع لحد كبير مسار بيتخطى التأثير الثقافي أو السياسي، وإنو هيدي التكنولوجيا إلها ""تأثيرات"" على المجتمعات المتأصلة، بدل ما تكون مشروطة اجتماعياً. مثلاً، ممكن يقول الشخص أن السيارة بتودي بالضرورة لتطوير الطرق. شبكة الطرق الوطنية مش مجدية اقتصاديًا لعدد قليل من السيارات، لهيك تم تطوير طرق إنتاج جديدة لتقليل تكلفة امتلاك سيارة. بتأدي الملكية الجماعية للسيارات كمان لإرتفاع معدل الحوادث على الطرق، الشي اللي بيأدي لابتكار تقنيات جديدة بمجال الرعاية الصحية لإصلاح الأجسام التالفة."
mt: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in the practice of technology, from pushing technology or technological determinism to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an inherent logic related to scientific laws and its appearance in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two basic ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path that is largely determined by the cultural or political impact, and that it is a ""technology"" that has ""effects"" on societies, rather than being socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the car necessarily leads to the development of roads. A national highway system is not economically beneficial for a small number of cars, so new production techniques were developed to reduce the cost of owning a car. Collective ownership of cars also leads to an increase in road accidents, which in turn leads to the development of new technologies in the field of health care to repair damaged bodies."
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: "وبياخد ""رمز up bow"" شكل حرف V ورمز ""down bow"" شكل مربع بدون جانبه السفلي. بتعني كلمة Up إنك لازم تشد القوس وتضغط عليه وكلمة down بتعني إنه لازم بتبلش من مكان ما حاطط إيدك عالقوس وتسحبه لبرا. عادةً ما بيخلق القوس العلوي صوت أكتر نعومة، بالوقت يلّي بكون فيه الانحناء السفلي أقوى وأكتر حزم. ما تتردد بجط علاماتك الخاصة بالقلم الرصاص، بس تذكر أن علامات الانحناء المطبوعة موجودة لسبب موسيقي، منهيك عادةً لازم احترامها."
mt: "And take the "up bow" symbol, which looks like a V, and the "down bow" symbol, which looks like a square without its bottom side. The word "up" means that you have to pull the bow and press it, and the word "down" means that you have to release the bow from somewhere where your hand is placed on the bow and pull it back. The upper bow is usually created with a softer sound, while the lower bow is stronger and more forceful. Don't be afraid to use your own marks, but remember that the printed bow marks are there for a musical reason, and you should usually respect them."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: بعكس غير قرود، بطّلت القردة العليا تستعمل إيديا بالحركة أو تحمل وزن أو تتمرجح بين الشجر. إيدين وإجرين الشمبانزي هي بنفس الحجم والطول، وهيدا بيعكس إستعمال الإيد بحمل الاوزان بالمشي على المفاصل. الايد البشرية أقصر من القدم ، مع أصابع أكتر استقامة. تكشف عظام اليد الأحفورية يلّي بيبلغ عمرها من مليونين لتلات ملايين سنة عن هيدا التحول بتخصص اليد من الحركة للتلاعب.
mt: Unlike other apes, the upper primates do not use their hands for locomotion or to carry weight or to swing between trees. The chimpanzee's hands and feet are of equal length, which contradicts the use of the hand for carrying weight while walking on the joints. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with more straight fingers. The fossilized bones of the hand, which are about two to three million years old, reveal this transformation from the use of the hand for movement to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: أظهرت أبحاث القرن العشرين إنه في مجموعتين من التنوعات الجينية: مخفية وظاهرة. بتضيف الطفرة تباين جيني جديد، وبيشيلها الاختيار من مجموعة التباين الواضح. الفصل وإعادة التركيب بيبدل التباين ذهابًا وإيابًا بين المجموعتين مع كل جيل.
mt: 20th century research showed that in two genetic variations: hidden and apparent. Adding the mutation introduces a new genetic variation, and the selection from the obvious variation. The separation and recombination alternates the variation between the two groups with each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: "بسهول السافانا، من الصعب على الرئيسيات اللي عندها جهاز هضمي متل البشر إنو تلبي حاجاتها من الأحماض الأمينية من الموارد النباتية المتاحة. كمان الفشل بعمل هالشي إلو عواقب وخيمة: كآبة النمو وسوء التغذية والموت بالآخر. كانت أكتر الموارد النباتية يلّي من الممكن الوصول لإلها بسهولة هي البروتينات يلّي ممكن الوصول لإلها بالوراق والبقوليات، بس صعب على الانسان هضمها إذا ما انطبخت. بالمقابل، فالمأكولات الحيوانية (النمل والنمل الأبيض والبيض) مش بس هين هشمها، بس بتعطي كميات عالية من البروتين يلّي فيها كل الأحماض الأمينية الأساسية. باعتبار كل شي، لازم ما نتفاجأ إذا حلّوا أسلافنا  ""مشكلة البروتين الأولى"" بنفس الطريقة التي بيعملها الشمبانزي بالسافانا اليوم."
mt: "In the savanna, it is difficult for primates with a digestive system like ours to meet their needs for amino acids from the available plant resources. Likewise, failure to do so has serious consequences: stunted growth, malnutrition, and death. The most accessible plant resources were proteins that could be obtained from the leaves and legumes, but it is difficult for humans to digest them if they are raw. On the other hand, animal foods (ants, termites, and eggs) not only digest them, but also provide high levels of protein that contain all the essential amino acids. Given all this, we should not be surprised if our ancestors solved the "protein problem" in the same way that chimpanzees in the savanna do today."
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."
