In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: بتجمع الثقافات الفرعية بين الأفراد يلّي عقليتهم متشابهة ويلّي بحسّوا انهم مهملين بسبب المعايير الاجتماعية وبيسمحولهن بتطوير الشعور بالانتماء. ممكن أنّو تكون الثقافات الفرعية مميزة بسبب العمر والعرق والطبقة والموقع و/أو جنس الأعضاء. ممكن تكون الصفات يلّي بتحدد ثقافة فرعية متميزة هي لغوية أو جمالية أو دينية أو سياسية أو جنسية أو جغرافية أو مجموعة من العوامل. بيشير أعضاء ثقافة فرعية دايماً لعضويتهم باستخدام مميز ورمزي للأسلوب، واللي بيتضمن أنماط وسلوكيات ولغة خاصة.
mt: Subcultures are formed when individuals with similar psyches feel neglected by social standards and are allowed to develop a sense of belonging. Subcultures may be distinguished by age, race, class, location, or gender of members. Characteristics that define a subculture may include linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture always identify themselves with a distinctive style, which includes specific fashions, behaviors, and language.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: يطور الأطفال وعي بالعرق وأفكار نمطية عنصرية بسن مبكرة كتير وهيدي الأفكار النمطية العنصرية بتؤثر على السلوك. مثلاً، الأطفال يلّي بينتموا لأقلية عرقية المعروف عنها أن ولادها ما بكون أدائهم منيح بالمدرسة بيصير أدائهم مش منيح بالمدرسة بمجرد ما يتعرفوا على الصورة النمطية المرتبطة بعرقهم.
mt: Children develop awareness of race and racial stereotypes at a young age, and these stereotypes can affect behavior. For example, children who are told that members of a racial minority are not good at school may perform worse in school after they are shown a picture of a member of that racial group.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: "وحدة من الطرق الأكتر شيوعًا المستعملة لتوضيح أهمية التنشئة الاجتماعية هي الاعتماد على عدد قليل من الحالات المؤسفة لأطفال كانوا بسبب الإهمال أو سوء الحظ أو الإساءة المتعمدة، غير اجتماعيين من قبل الكبار هني وعم يكبروا. بتم تصنيف بعض الأطفال على إنهم "" وحشيين ""، وهيدا التصنيف انبثق عن كتير أشخاص (وبكتير من الاحيان بكونوا هودي الأشخاص هنّي أهلهم) وببعض الحالات بتنتج هيدي الوحشية عند الأولاد يلي بتم رفضهم من قبل أهلهم لضعف كبير بذهنية أو جسم الطفل. ممكن يكونوا الأطفال المتوحشين تعرضوا لإساءة معاملة الأطفال أو الصدمات القوية قبل التخلي عنهم أو الهروب. ويُزعم إنو البعض تربى مع الحيوانات؛ ويُقال إنو البعض عاش بالبرية لوحدو. لما يتربى الولد مع حيوانات غير بشرية ببلش يعمل حركات (ضمن الحدود الجسدية) بتشبه تمامًا حركات الحيوانات متل خوفه من البشر أو لا مبالاته تجاههم."
mt: "One of the most commonly used ways to illustrate the importance of socialization is to rely on a few unfortunate cases of children who were neglected or misfortunate or deliberately mistreated by adults, and who grew up to be "" wild "" people. This classification has arisen from many people (and often these people were the children's parents) and in some cases the wildness of the children was produced by the rejection of the children by their parents due to a severe mental or physical weakness of the child. The wild children may have been subjected to child abuse or severe shocks before being abandoned or running away. It is claimed that some were raised with animals; it is said that some lived in the wild alone."
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: زراعة الكفاف هي الزراعة يلّي بتم لإنتاج ما يكفي من الأكل لتلبية احتياجات المزارع وعيلتو بس. زراعة الكفاف هي نظام بسيط، وعضوي بكتير من الأحيان، بيستعمل البذور المحفوظة الأصلية بالإكورجيون بجانب بعضها مع دوران المحاصيل أو غيرها من التقنيات البسيطة نسبياً لزيادة العائد. تاريخياً، معظم المزارعين كانوا يشتغلوا بزراعة الكفاف، وهيدا الحال بعدو هو ذاته بالدول النامية.
mt: Subsistence farming is the farming of food for one's own family's use, rather than for sale off the farm. It is a simple, organic system, often using heirloom seeds and the original crop varieties, with rotation of crops or other simple techniques to increase yield. Historically, most farmers have practiced subsistence farming, and this is still the case in developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: يمكن يكون أكتر نوع سياحة شائع هو النوع اللي بيربطو معظم الناس بالسفر: السياحة الترفيهية. وهيدا بيصير لما يروحوا الناس عمكان بيختلف تماما عن حياتهم اليومية المعتادين عليها ليسترخوا ويستمتعموا. غالبًا بتكون الشواطئ والمتنزهات والمخيمات هي أكتر أماكن بروحوا عليها السياح الترفيهيين. إذا كان الهدف من زيارة الشخص لمكان معين هو التعرف على تاريخه وثقافته، فهيدا النوع من السياحة اسمه السياحة الثقافية. ممكن يزور السياح أكتر من معلم سياحي بنفس البلد أو ممكن يركزوا على منطقة واحدة.
mt: The most common type of tourism is the type that most people associate with travel: recreational tourism. This is what people do when they leave their usual daily lives to relax and enjoy themselves. Beaches, parks, and campsites are often the places that recreational tourists visit. If a person's goal in visiting a particular place is to learn about its history and culture, this type of tourism is called cultural tourism. Tourists may visit more than one tourist attraction in the same country or they may focus on one region.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: ساعدنا الأشخاص يلّي شاركو لعدة عقود ساعدونا بتقدير نقاط قوتنا وشغفنا بوقت تقييم الصعوبات وحتى الفشل بصراحة. بوقت سماع الأشخاص وهم عم يشاركوا قصصهم الفردية والعائلية والتنظيمية، اكتسبنا فكرة عميقة عن الماضي وبعض الشخصيات اللي أثرت بشكل منيح أو سيء على ثقافة المنظمة. فهم تاريخ شخص ما بيعني بالضرورة فهم الثقافة، إلا أنهو ممكن يساعد الناس على الأقل إنهم يكتسبوا فكرة عن المكان اللي بيتواجدوا فيه ضمن تاريخ المنظمة. بوقت تقييم النجاحات ومعرفة حالات الفشل ، بيكتشف كل المشاركين بشكل أعمق القيم والرسالة والقوى الدافعة للمنظمة. بهيدي الحالة، استرجاع الحالات السابقة لسلوك ريادة الأعمال والنجاحات الناتجة عن عنها ساعد الناس على الانفتاح على التغييرات الجديدة والتوجهات الجديدة للكنيسة المحلية. قصص النجاح قللت من مخاوف التغيير، وسمحت بخلق طاقة إيجابية نحو التغيير بالمستقبل.
mt: People have shared with us for decades how they have helped us to appreciate our strengths and our passion for evaluating our challenges and even our failures honestly. Hearing people share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained a deep understanding of the past and some of the people who have positively or negatively influenced the culture of the organization. Understanding someone's history means, by definition, understanding the culture, but it can also help people understand where they are in the organization's history. Evaluating successes and learning from failures, people gained a deeper understanding of the organization's values, mission, and driving forces. In this case, recalling past entrepreneurial behavior and the successes that resulted from it helped people open up to new changes and new directions for the local church. Success stories reduced fears of change, and allowed the creation of positive energy towards future change.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: نهج ما بعد الحداثة بقدم للتعلم التحرر من المطلقات، فما في طريقة منيحة للتعلم. بالواقع، ما في شي واحد منيح ممكن تتعلمه، فالتعلم بصير بتجربة بين المتعلم والمعرفة المقدمة. تجربتنا الحالية مع كل العروض التليفزيونية القائمة على التعلم والتعليم الذاتي وتقديم المعلومات بتوضح هيدي النقطة. بلاقي كتير منا حالن عم بيشوفو عرض تلفزيوني بيخبرنا بعملية أو تجربة ما حنشارك فيها أو نطبق هيدي المعرفة أبدًا. ما رح نصلّح أبدا السيارات أو نبني نافورة بالساحة الخلفية أو نسافر عبيرو لفحص الآثار القديمة أو نعيد تصميم بيت جيراننا.
mt: Postmodernism takes a step back from learning to free oneself from absolutes, for there is nothing right to learn, for learning is a process between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the television shows based on learning and self-education and presenting information clearly shows this point. Many of us are currently watching a television show that tells us about a process or experience that we will participate in or apply this knowledge forever. We will never fix cars or build a fountain in the backyard or travel to the ancient ruins or redesign our neighbors' homes.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: انقطاع النوم هو لما تفيق بشكل متعمد بفترة نومك العادية وتنام بعد وقت قصير (10-60 دقيقة). وهيدا الشي ممكن يتحقق بسهولة باستعمال منبه هادي نسبيًا حتى ترجع لوعيك بدون ما تفيق تمامًا. إذا لقيت حالك عم ترجع تضبط المنبه أنت ونايم، ففيك تحطه بالجانب التاني من الغرفة، هيدا الشي رح يجبرك أن تقوم من التخت لتوقف تشغيله. بتضمن الخيارات التانية المرتكزة على النظم الحيوي شرب كميات كبيرة من السوائل (خاصة المي أو الشاي، واحد من مدرات البول المعروفة) قبل النوم، الشي اللي بيجبر الشخص إنو يقوم من النوم للتبول.
mt: Narcolepsy is when you wake up intentionally for a period of your usual sleep and sleep again after a short time (10-60 minutes). This can be easily achieved by using a relatively mild alarm until you return to your sleep without waking up completely. If you find yourself returning to set the alarm and sleep, put it on the other side of the room, which will force you to get up from the bed to turn it off. You can also ensure other options based on the biological system drink large amounts of liquids (especially water or tea, one of the known diuretics) before sleep, which forces the person to wake up to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: بيعتقد بعض الناس إنو تجربة عدة أحلام صافية مستحثة بشكل مصطنع بتكون مرهقة كتير على الغلب. السبب الرئيسي لهيدي الظاهرة هو نتيجة الأحلام الواضحة يلّي بتمتد طول الفترة الزمنية بين حالات حركة العين السريعة. بعدد قليل من حركات العين السريعة ممكن تنام لوقت كافي ويتعافى جسمك من أي مشكلة. هيدا أمر متعب تمامًا متل لو إنك عم تفيق كل عشرين أو تلاتين دقيقة وتتفرج عالتلفزيون. بيعتمد التأثير على عدد المرات يلّي بحاول فيها عقلك أنّو يحلم بوضوح كل ليلة.
mt: Some people believe that lucid dreaming, a state of dreaming in which one is aware that one is dreaming, is exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of clear dreams that last for a long period of time. A few eye movements can cause you to sleep for a long enough time to recover from any problems. This is very tiring, like if you wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect depends on the number of times you try to have a clear dream every night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: "بتخضع الفرق الافتراضية لنفس معايير الامتياز متل الفرق التقليدية، إلا إنو في اختلافات بسيطة. بيشتغل أعضاء الفريق الافتراضي غالباً كنقطة اتصال لمجموعتهم المادية المباشرة. وبيتمتعوا غالبًا باستقلالية أكبر من أعضاء الفريق التقليديين لأن ممكن تجتمع فرقهم بالتوافق مع المناطق الزمنية المختلفة اللي ممكن ما تفهمها إدارتهم المحلية. وجود ""فريق مش منشاف"" حقيقي (Larson and LaFasto، 1989، p109) هو كمان عنصر فريد من نوعه للفريق الافتراضي. الفريق غير المرئي هو فريق الإدارة يلّي بيَتبَعُه كل عضو، ويضع الفريق غير المرئي المعايير لكل عضو."
mt: "Virtual teams are subject to the same standards of excellence as traditional teams, except for some minor differences. Members of virtual teams often act as a liaison for their physical team. They often have greater autonomy than traditional team members because they can meet with their team at times that are convenient for them and their local management. A "real" virtual team (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique feature of virtual teams. The invisible team is the management team that each member follows, and the invisible team sets the standards for each member."
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: تركز نظريات المحتوى على إيجاد شو يلّي بيجذب الناس. بتشير هيدي النظريات لأنّو الناس عندهم احتياجات و / أو رغبات معينة تم استيعابها عند نضوجهم لمرحلة البلوغ. بتنبّش هيدي النظريات عن ماهية بعض الأشخاص يلّي بخلوهن بدّن الأشيا يلّي بيعملوها وشو الأشيا ببيئتهم يلّي بتخلين يعملوا أو ما يعملوا وأشيا معينة. نظريتين منتشرين للمحتوى هن التسلسل الهرمي لنظرية الاحتياجات لماسلو ونظرية العامل التاني لهيرتسبرج.
mt: Content theories focus on finding what attracts people. They refer to people having certain needs and/or desires that are internalized at the time of their maturation to the stage of puberty. They refer to what some people do to produce things that they do, what things they do in their environment that they do or do not do, and certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's hierarchy of needs theory and Herzberg's second factor theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: قاعدة التلت يلّي يُساء استعمالها ويلّي غالبًا بتم الاستهزاء فيها هي مبدأ توجيهي بسيط بيخلق ديناميكية مع الحفاظ على شوي من النظام بالصورة. بتقول أن المحل الأكتر فاعلية للموضوع الرئيسي هو عند مفترق الخطوط يلّي بيقسم الصورة لتلات أقصام عموديًا وأفقيًا (شوف المتل).
mt: 3-2-1 Go! is a simple guiding principle that creates dynamics while maintaining some order in the chaos. It is said that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of the lines, where the image is divided into three vertical and horizontal sections (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: مثلاً، تنسيق التصوير الفوتوغرافي الأكتر شيوعًا للصور الثابتة بالعالم هو 35 ملم، وهو الحجم المهيمن للفيلم بنهاية عصر الفيلم التناظري. بعدن لليوم عم ينتجوه، بس الأهم من هيك أن نسبة الأبعاد تبعها ورثتها تنسيقات أشكال مستشعر الصور بالكاميرا الرقمية.. تصميم بــ 35 مم هو بالواقع مربك لحدٍ ما، فيفضل إنّو يكون 36 مم عرض و 24 مم ارتفاع. نسبة جوانب هيدا الشكل (مقسمة على تنعش للحصول على أبسط نسبة عدد كامل) هي 3:2. عدد كبير من التنسيقات الشائعة (مجموعة تنسيقات نظام الصور المتقدم مثلاً) مساوية أو قريبة لنسبة الطول للعرض هيدي.
mt: 35 mm is the most common still photography image format in the world, the dominant film format in the era of analog photography. It is now produced, but the important thing is that the aspect ratios of the image sensors in digital cameras have inherited the same aspect ratio. The 35 mm format is actually a bit awkward, and it is preferable that it be 36 mm wide and 24 mm high. The ratio of the sides of this shape (divided by the square root to get the simplest integer ratio) is 3:2. A large number of common formats (such as the Advanced Photo System) are equal to or close to the ratio of length to width.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: من سيئات عدسات التكبير هو أنّو التعقيد البؤري وعدد عناصر العدسة المطلوبة لتحقيق أطول نطاق أكبر بكتير من العدسات الأولية. صارت المشكلة أقل خطر لأن مصنعي العدسات عم يحققوا معايير أعلى بإنتاج العدسات. الأمر اللي سمح لعدسات الزووم بإنتاج صور بجودة بتتفوق على الصور اللي حققتها العدسات يلي إلها بعد ثابت. عدسات الزوم عندها عيب تاني هو أن الفتحة القصوى (السرعة) للعدسة عادةً بتكون أقل. وهيدا بصعّب استعمال عدسات الزووم الرخيصة بحالات الضو الخافت بدون فلاش.
mt: 1. The complexity of the lens and the number of lens elements required to achieve a longer focal length is greater than that of the original lens. The problem has become less dangerous as lens manufacturers have achieved higher standards in the production of lenses. This allowed zoom lenses to produce images of quality that exceeded those achieved by fixed-focus lenses. Zoom lenses have another defect that the maximum aperture (speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes cheap zoom lenses difficult to use in low light without flash.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: التصوف هو السعي للاتحاد مع، أو التماهي مع، أو الإدراك الواعي لواقع مطلق أو ألوهية أو حقيقة روحية أو الله. بيسعى المؤمن لتجربة مباشرة وحدس أو رؤية للواقع الإلهي أو المخالفات. بيتبع المتابعين طرق معينة للعيش، أو ممارسات بتهدف لتغذية هيدي التجارب. ممكن تمييز التصوف عن الأشكال التانية للمعتقد الديني والعبادة من خلال تأكيدو على التجربة الشخصية المباشرة لحالة وعي فريدة من نوعا، خصوصاً اللي إلها طابع سلمي وبصيرة وسعادة أو حتى نشوة.
mt: Mysticism is the pursuit of oneness, or union, or identity, with, or absorption into, or direct experience of, absolute or divine or spiritual truth or God. The believer seeks direct experience or hunch or vision of the divine reality or the other. The followers of mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by their emphasis on personal direct experience of a unique state of consciousness, especially one characterized by peace, insight, and joy or even ecstasy.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: لفترة طويلة بالقرنين التسعتعش والعشرين، كان يُعتقد أن السكان الأوائل لنيوزيلندا هم شعب الماوري، يلّي بتصيضوا الطيور العملاقة اسمها المواس. وأنشأت النظرية فكرة إنه الشعب الماوري هاجر من بولينيزيا بأسطول ضخم ووصلوا على نيوزيلندا من موريوري ليأسسوا مجتمع زراعي. بتظهر الأدلة الجديدة أن الموريوري كانوا مجموعة من الماوريين من الأرض الرئيسية يلّي هاجروا من نيوزيلندا لجزر تشاتام، وطوروا ثقافتهم المميزة والسلمية. كانت في كمان قبيلة تانية بجزر تشاتام هودي هنّي الماوري يلّي هاجروا بعيد عن نيوزيلندا. سمّوا حالهم باسم الموريوري وكان في عدد قليل من المناوشات إلا إنه بالنهاية تم القضاء عليهم.
mt: For a long time in the 19th and 20th centuries, it was believed that the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori, who hunted the giant birds called moa. The theory suggested that the Maori had migrated from Polynesia in a large fleet and arrived in New Zealand from Moriori to establish an agricultural society. New evidence shows that the Moriori were a group of Maori from the mainland who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, and developed their distinctive and peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham Islands who were not Maori, who eventually migrated away from New Zealand. They were called the Moriori and there were few skirmishes, but in the end they were wiped out.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: لفترة طويلة بالقرنين التسعتعش والعشرين، كان يُعتقد أن السكان الأوائل لنيوزيلندا هم شعب الماوري، يلّي بتصيضوا الطيور العملاقة اسمها المواس. وأنشأت النظرية فكرة إنه الشعب الماوري هاجر من بولينيزيا بأسطول ضخم ووصلوا على نيوزيلندا من موريوري ليأسسوا مجتمع زراعي. بتظهر الأدلة الجديدة أن الموريوري كانوا مجموعة من الماوريين من الأرض الرئيسية يلّي هاجروا من نيوزيلندا لجزر تشاتام، وطوروا ثقافتهم المميزة والسلمية. كانت في كمان قبيلة تانية بجزر تشاتام هودي هنّي الماوري يلّي هاجروا بعيد عن نيوزيلندا. سمّوا حالهم باسم الموريوري وكان في عدد قليل من المناوشات إلا إنه بالنهاية تم القضاء عليهم.
mt: For a long time in the 19th and 20th centuries, it was believed that the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori, who hunted the giant birds called moa. The theory suggested that the Maori had migrated from Polynesia in a large fleet and arrived in New Zealand from Moriori to establish an agricultural society. New evidence shows that the Moriori were a group of Maori from the mainland who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, and developed their distinctive and peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham Islands who were not Maori, who eventually migrated away from New Zealand. They were called the Moriori and there were few skirmishes, but in the end they were wiped out.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: فن بيورلاند لطوي الورق هو فن طوي ورق مع التقيد بطوية وحدة بكل مرة واحدة، وممنوع استعمال الطويات المعقدة متل الطوية العكسية، وكل الطويات إلها مواقع مباشرة. طورو جون سميث بالسبعينات لمساعدة المجلدات عديمة الخبرة أو اللي عندا مهارات حركية محدودة.
mt: Paperfolding is a paperfolding art where each fold is done in one direction, and complex folds such as reverse folds are forbidden. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: حضارة وادي السند كانت حضارة العصر البرونزي بشبه القارة الهندية الشمالية الغربية وبتضم معظم باكستان الحديثة وبعض المناطق بشمال غرب الهند وشمال شرق أفغانستان. ازدهرت الحضارة بأحواض نهر إندوس من المحل يلّي اجا اسمها. على الرغم من أن بعض العلماء بيتكهنوا أن ما أن الحضارة موجودة كمان بأحواض نهر ساراسفاتي الجاف هلأ ، لازم تُسمى حضارة إندوس-ساراسفاتي، بينما بيسميها البعض حضارة هارابان بعد هارابا، أول مواقعها يلّي تم التنقيب عنها بعشرينات القرن الماضي.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was an early Bronze Age civilization in the northwestern regions of the Indian subcontinent, and one of the largest in the world. It flourished in the basins of the Indus River and the Punjab region, extending from northeast Afghanistan to the Siwalik Hills in Nepal. The Indus Valley Civilization was one of the largest early urban civilizations, along with the contemporary civilizations in Egypt and Mesopotamia. The Indus Valley Civilization was a highly developed civilization, with large well-planned cities, advanced town planning, and sophisticated drainage systems. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: رح يضل الجشع والأنانية دايماً معنا، ومن طبيعة التعاون أنه بس تستفيد الأغلبية رح يكون في دايمًا مكاسب أكتر على المدى القصير من خلال التصرف بأنانية. منتمنى أن يعرف معظم الناس أن أفضل خيار على المدى الطويل هو العمل مع الناس التانيين.
mt: Greed and selfishness will always be with us, and by nature of cooperation, the majority will always benefit in the short term by acting selfishly. I hope most people realize that the best long-term option is to work with others.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: ودفع الشعب الفلبيني نفقات حرب الإمبريالية الأمريكية باحتلال الفلبين. واتم إجبارهم على دفع ضرايب للنظام الاستعماري الأمريكي لتتحمل جزء كبير من النفقات والفوايد على السندات اللي تم تعويمها باسم الحكومة الفلبينية من خلال المؤسسات المصرفية بوول ستريت. وأكيد الأرباح الكبيرة الناتجة عن الاستغلال المطول للشعب الفلبيني رح تشكل المكاسب الأساسية للإمبريالية الأمريكية.
mt: The Filipino people paid the costs of the American imperialist war of occupation of the Philippines. They were forced to pay taxes to the American imperialist system to bear a large part of the costs and profits on the bonds that were floated in the name of the Philippine government through Wall Street financial institutions. The large profits resulting from the long exploitation of the Filipino people will certainly form the main gains of the American imperialists.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: لحتى تفهم فرسان الهيكل، لازم تفهم السبب اللي دفع لإنشاؤه. يشار عادةً للوقت يلّي وقعت فيه الأحداث على أنها العصور الوسطى العليا لفترة التاريخ الأوروبي بالقرون 11 و12 و13 (1000-1300 م). سبقت العصور الوسطى العليا العصور الوسطى المبكرة وتبعها أواخر العصور الوسطى، ويليّ بتنتهي بحكم الاتفاقية بحوالي سنة 1500.
mt: To understand the Knights Templar, you must understand the reason they were created. The period in which the events took place is usually referred to as the High Middle Ages for the history of Europe in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (1000-1300 AD). The High Middle Ages followed the Early Middle Ages and preceded the Late Middle Ages, which ended by convention around 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: ساعدت الطبيعة العسكرية للإمبراطورية الرومانية بتطوير التقدم الطبي. بلَّش الإمبراطور أوغسطس بتجنيد الأطبا وشكلوا أول فيلق طبي روماني لاستعماله بأعقاب المعارك. كان عند الجراحين معرفة بمختلف المهدئات بما فيها المورفين من مستخلصات بذور الخشخاش والكوبولامين من بذور الهنباني وبسمّوا كمان البنج الأسود. وصاروا بارعين ببتر الأعضاء لإنقاذ المرضى من الغرغرينا والمشابك الشريانية لوقف تدفق الدم. على مدى عدة قرون، أدت الإمبراطورية الرومانية لمكاسب كبيرة في مجال الطب وشكلت الكتير من المعرفة اللي منعرفها اليوم.
mt: The Roman Empire's military nature helped develop medical progress. Emperor Augustus recruited physicians and formed the first Roman military medical corps to be used after battles. Surgeons knew of various anesthetics including morphine from poppy seed extracts and coca leaf cocaine and also poisoned black bryony. They were skilled in amputation to save patients from gangrene and arterial thrombosis to stop blood flow. Over several centuries, the Roman Empire made great strides in medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: بيعتمد النظر على الأعضاء الحسية المرتبطة بالجهاز البصري أو العينين. في عدة تركيبات مختلفة للعيون، بتتراوح بالتعقيد حسب متطلبات الكائن الحي. بتتميز الهياكل بقدرات مختلفة، وهي حساسة لأطوال الموجات ولديها درجات مختلفة من الحدة، كمان بتتطلب معالجة لفهم المدخلات والأرقام المختلفة للعمل على النحو الأفضل.
mt: The eyes are sensory organs that are part of the visual system. In many different configurations of eyes, the complexity varies according to the requirements of the organism. They are sensitive to different wavelengths of light and have different degrees of acuity, and require processing to understand the inputs and different numbers of operations to work best.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: "السيخية دين من شبه القارة الهندية. نشأت بمنطقة البنجاب بالقرن الخمستعش من الانقسام الطائفي بالتقاليد الهندوسية. بيعتبر السيخ دينهم منفصل عن الهندوسية بالرغم من اعترافهم بجذورو وتقاليدو الهندوسية. بيسمي السيخ دينهم غورمات، اللي بتعني بالبنجابية ""طريقة المعلم"". المعلم هو جانب أساسي لكل الديانات الهندية بس اكتسب بالسيخية أهمية بتشكل جوهر معتقدات السيخ. تأسست هيدي الديانة بالقرن الخمستعش على ايد جورو ناناك 1469-1539. لحقها دغري تسعة معلمين تانيين."
mt: "Sikhism is a religion that originated in the Punjab region of the Indian subcontinent around the 15th century. It is one of the youngest of the world's major religions. Sikhism is based on the teachings of Guru Nanak and, excepting the first, the ten subsequent gurus (the last of whom was Guru Gobind Singh) who are the founders and leaders of the Sikh religion. The term "Guru" means "teacher" in the Punjabi language. The first Guru, Nanak, was a Hindu by birth, and the last Guru, Gobind Singh, was a Muslim by birth. The Sikh Gurus expounded a universal religion based on the belief in one God, the universality of all human beings and equality of men and women. Sikhism is a monotheistic religion. The Sikh holy book is called the Guru Granth Sahib. The Guru Granth Sahib is the final, complete, and authoritative Guru of the Sikhs. It is the source of Sikh doctrine and the ultimate spiritual authority for Sikhs. The Guru Granth Sahib is a collection of the writings of the ten Sikh Gurus and other saints and mystics from various religions. The Guru Granth Sahib is written in the Gurmukhi script, which is a script developed by the Sikh Gurus. ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: "السيخية دين من شبه القارة الهندية. نشأت بمنطقة البنجاب بالقرن الخمستعش من الانقسام الطائفي بالتقاليد الهندوسية. بيعتبر السيخ دينهم منفصل عن الهندوسية بالرغم من اعترافهم بجذورو وتقاليدو الهندوسية. بيسمي السيخ دينهم غورمات، اللي بتعني بالبنجابية ""طريقة المعلم"". المعلم هو جانب أساسي لكل الديانات الهندية بس اكتسب بالسيخية أهمية بتشكل جوهر معتقدات السيخ. تأسست هيدي الديانة بالقرن الخمستعش على ايد جورو ناناك 1469-1539. لحقها دغري تسعة معلمين تانيين."
mt: "Sikhism is a religion that originated in the Punjab region of the Indian subcontinent around the 15th century. It is one of the youngest of the world's major religions. Sikhism is based on the teachings of Guru Nanak and, excepting the first, the ten subsequent gurus (the last of whom was Guru Gobind Singh) who are the founders and leaders of the Sikh religion. The term "Guru" means "teacher" in the Punjabi language. The first Guru, Nanak, was a Hindu by birth, and the last Guru, Gobind Singh, was a Muslim by birth. The Sikh Gurus expounded a universal religion based on the belief in one God, the universality of all human beings and equality of men and women. Sikhism is a monotheistic religion. The Sikh holy book is called the Guru Granth Sahib. The Guru Granth Sahib is the final, complete, and authoritative Guru of the Sikhs. It is the source of Sikh doctrine and the ultimate spiritual authority for Sikhs. The Guru Granth Sahib is a collection of the writings of the ten Sikh Gurus and other saints and mystics from various religions. ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: "اضطراب نقص الانتباه ""هو متلازمة عصبية عنده تلات أعراض تقليدية يلّي هنّي الاندفاع، والتشتت، وفرط النشاط أو الطاقة الزايدة"""". هي مش إعاقة بالتعلم، هي اضطراب بالتعلم؛ ""بصيب من 3 لـ 5 بالمية من كل الأطفال، وممكن يوصل لمليونين طفل أمريكي"". بواجهوا الأطفال المصابين باضطراب نقص الانتباه (ADD) صعوبة بالتركيز على أشياء متل العمل المدرسي، بس بيقدروا يركزوا على الأشيا يلّي بحبوا يعملوها متل اللعب أو مشاهدة الرسوم المتحركة المفضلة عندهم أو كتابة الجمل بدون تنقيط. بميلوا هودي الأطفال للتورط بكتير مشاكل، لأنهم ""بينخرطوا بسلوكيات خطرة وبيتشاجروا وبيتحدّوا السلطة"" كرمال تحفيز عقولهم، لأن عقولهم ما بتقدر تحفزها بالطرق العادية. بأثر اضطراب نقص الانتباه على العلاقات مع أشخاص مماثلين تانيين لأن الأطفال التانيين ما بيقدروا يفهموا سبب الطريقة يلّي بيتصرفوا فيها أو سبب لفظهم بهيدي الطريقة أو اختلاف مستوى نضجهم."
mt: "Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD) is a neurological condition characterized by three cardinal symptoms: impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or increased energy." It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; "between 3 and 5 percent of all children, and possibly millions of American children." Children with ADD have difficulty focusing on things such as schoolwork, but can focus on things they enjoy doing such as playing or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without proofreading. They tend to get involved in more problems, because they "get into dangerous behaviors and they argue and they challenge authority" to stimulate their minds, because their minds cannot be stimulated in the usual ways. ADD affects relationships with similar others because other children cannot understand why they act the way they do or why they say things in this way or why they are different in maturity level.
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: بالرغم من إنو التعلم المعتمد على المشاريع لازم يخلي التعلم أسهل وأبسط، إلا إنو طريقة السقالات scaffolding بتروح لأبعد من هيك. التقنيات التعليمية التدريجية مش طريقة للتعلم بل وسيلة مساعدة بتقدم الدعم للأشخاص اللي عم يمرقو بتجربة تعليمية جديدة متل استخدام برنامج كمبيوتر جديد أو بداية مشروع جديد. يمكن تكون التقنيات التعليمية التدريجية افتراضية وحقيقية، يعني الإستاذ هو شكل من أشكال التقنيات التعليمية التدريجية، وكمان المساعد اللي على مايكروسوفت أوفيس. تم إدراج دعم افتراضي (Virtual Scaffolds) بتساعد بطرح أسئلة وشرح الإجراءات اللي ممكن ما يعرف التلميذ يحلها وحده.
mt: Despite the fact that project-based learning is supposed to make learning easier and simpler, scaffolding goes beyond that.  Scaffolding is not a way of learning but a way of providing support to people who are going through a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or starting a new project. Scaffolding can be virtual and physical, meaning a teacher is a form of scaffolding, as well as a Microsoft Office assistant. Virtual scaffolding (V-Scaffolds) can help by posing questions and explaining procedures that the student may not know how to solve on their own.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: يُعتبر موقع ماي سبايس تالت أشهر مواقع الويب المستعملة بالولايات المتحدة وعندو 54 مليون ملف تعريف حاليًا. حصلت هيدي المواقع الإلكترونية على اهتمام كبير، بالأخص ببيئة التعليم. في جوانب إيجابية لهيدي المواقع ويلّي بتشمل القدرة على إعداد صفحة الفصل بسهولة ويلّي ممكن أنّو بتتضمن مدونات ومقاطع فيديو وصور وميزات تانية. وممكن الوصول لهيدي الصفحة بسهولة من خلال توفير عنوان ويب، الشي اللي بسهّل تذكرها وكتابتها للتلاميذ اللي ممكن يواجهوا مشكلة باستعمال الكيبورد أو بالتهجئة. ممكن تعديلها لتسهيل القراية وبألوان كتيرة أو قليلة حسب الرغبة كمان.
mt: MySpace is the third most visited website in the United States, with 54 million registered users.  The site has attracted considerable attention, particularly in the educational environment.  In positive aspects of MySpace, it includes the ability to easily prepare a classroom page, which can include blogs, videos, and pictures, as well as other features.  It is easily accessible through a web address, which makes it easier to remember and write, for students who may have difficulty with the keyboard or spelling.  It can be modified to facilitate reading, with many or few colors, as desired.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: بحزيران 1956، انحطت وعود كروتشوف باختبار بس تحولت أعمال الشغب ببولندا، من عمال عم يحتجوا على نقص الأكل وتخفيض الأجور لاحتجاج عام ضد الشيوعية. على الرغم من أنه بالنهاية، بعت كروتشوف دبابات لاسترجاع النظام، أفسح المجال لبعض المطالب الاقتصادية ووافق على تعيين فلاديسلاف جومولكا الشهير رئيسًا للوزراء.
mt: 1956, Crochov's promises were tested by a test that turned into a riot in Poland, workers who were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts to an annual protest against communism. Although in the end, Crochov sold tanks to restore order, it opened the way for some economic demands and agreed to appoint Wladyslaw Gomulka, the famous prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: كانت ألمانيا عدو مشترك بالحرب العالمية التانية، يلّي أدى للتعاون بين الاتحاد السوفيتي والولايات المتحدة الأمريكية. مع انتهاء الحرب، أدت اشتباكات النظام والعملية والثقافة لسقوط الدول. مع مرور عامين على نهاية الحرب، صاروا الحلفاء السابقين أعداء اليوم وبهيك بلشت الحرب الباردة. كان مفروض تستمر 40 سنة وتخوضها جيوش حقيقية بالوكالة بساحات القتال من أفريقيا لآسيا وأفغانستان وكوبا ومطارح تانية كتيرة.
mt: Germany was a common enemy in World War II, leading to cooperation between the Soviet Union and the United States. After the war, clashes between the system, the operation, and the culture led to the fall of the countries. Two years after the end of the war, former allies became enemies today, and the Cold War began. It was supposed to last 40 years and be fought by real armies in battlefields from Africa to Asia, Afghanistan, Cuba, and other such places.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: بيحافظ الجهاز العصبي على الاستتباب عن طريق بعت نبضات عصبية عبر الجسم للحفاظ على تدفق الدم دون انقطاع. ممكن بعت هيدي النبضات العصبية بسرعة بكل أنحاء الجسم يلّي بيساعد بالحفاظ على الجسم آمن من أي تهديد محتمل.
mt: The nervous system maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses throughout the body to keep blood flowing without interruption. The impulses can be sent at high speed throughout the body, helping to keep the body safe from any potential threat.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: "الهرم الأكبر بالجيزة هو الوحيد من عجائب الدنيا السبع يلّي بعدها موجودة حتى اليوم. الهرم الأكبر يلّي بناه المصريين بالقرن التالت قبل الميلاد هو واحد من بين عدة هياكل هرمية كبيرة يلّي بنيت لتكريم الفرعون الميت. هضبة الجيزة، أو ""مقبرة الجيزة"" بوادي الموتى المصري بتحتوي على كتير أهرامات أكبرها الهرم الأكبر، وعدة مقابر صغيرة والعديد من المعابد والمعبد الكبير أبو الهول. تم إنشاء الهرم الأكبر لتكريم الفرعون خوفو، وتم بناء كتير من الأهرامات والمقابر والمعابد الأصغر لتكريم زوجات خوفو وأفراد عيلتو."

ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: تم تدمير معبد أرتميس بأفسس بــ 21 تموز 356 قبل الميلاد بحريق متعمد ارتكبه هيروستراتوس. بحسب القصة، كان هدفه الشهرة بأي ثمن. أعلن الأفسسيين الغاضبين أن اسم هيروستراتوس ما رح يتسجل أبدًا. لاحظ المؤرخ اليوناني سترابو إنّو تم تدمير المعبد بنفس الليلة يلّي خلق فيها الإسكندر الأكبر. عرض الإسكندر، بصفته ملك، إنو يدفع مقابل إعادة بناء الهيكل، بس رفضوا عرضه. بعدين، بس مات الإسكندر ، رجعوا بنوا المعبد سنة 323 قبل الميلاد.
mt: 21 July 356 BC, the Temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed by fire, allegedly set by Herostratus in order to gain fame at any cost. The Ephesians, enraged, vowed that the name of Herostratus would never be mentioned. The Greek historian Strabo noted that the temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay for the rebuilding of the structure, but they refused his offer. Later, after Alexander's death, they rebuilt the temple in 323 BC.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: أول وسيلة نقل معروفة كانت السير، بلّشوا البشر بالمشي المنتصب من مليونين سنة مع ظهور الإنسان المنتصب (يعني الرجال المستقيم). أسلافهم، أسترالوبيثكس، ما مشوا بشكل مستقيم متل ما اعتادوا. لاقوا أثر إجرتين بحفريات للقرود الجنوبية من 4.2-3.9 مليون سنة، على الرغم من أن ممكن يكون أناسي الساحل التشادي كان يمشي على اجرتين من سبعة ملايين سنة.
mt: The first known means of transportation was walking, humans began to walk upright around 2 million years ago with the appearance of Homo erectus (meaning upright men). Their ancestors, Australopithecus, did not walk upright as they were accustomed to. They found evidence of bipedalism in fossilized chimpanzees from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although the coastal ape may have walked on two legs from 7 million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: يعتبر استعمال السفن لنقل البضايع الطريقة الأكتر فعالية لنقل كميات كبيرة من الأشخاص والبضايع عبر المحيطات. كانت مهمة القوات البحرية تقليدياً هي ضمان احتفاظ بلدك بالقدرة على نقل أفرادك وبضاعتك، بينما بتتدخل بنفس الوقت بقدرة عدوك على نقل شعبه وبضاعتو. وحدة من أكتر الأمثلة الحديثة الجديرة بالملاحظة، كانت حملة شمال الأطلسي بالحرب العالمية التانية. كان الأميركان عم يحاولوا ينقلو الرجال والمواد عبر المحيط الأطلسي لمساعدة بريطانيا. بنفس الوقت، كانت البحرية الألمانية، عم تحاول توقف هيدي الحركة بواسطة الغواصات بشكل أساسي. لو فشلوا الحلفا، لكانت ألمانيا على الأرجح قادرة على غزو بريطانيا متل ما عملت مع بقية أوروبا.
mt: The use of ships to transport goods is the most efficient way to move large quantities of people and goods across oceans. Traditionally, the navy's job was to ensure that your country had the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time preventing your enemy from moving their people and goods. One of the most notable examples is the Battle of the Atlantic in World War II. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy was trying to stop this movement by submarines primarily. If they had succeeded, Germany would likely have been able to invade Britain just as it did the rest of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: اختراع دواليب بقضبان خلّى العربات الآشورية أخف وزن وأسرع وأكتر استعداد لتجاوز الجنود والمركبات التانية. ممكن أن تخترق أسهم الأقواس المميتة دروع الجنود المتنافسين. سنة 1000 قبل الميلاد تقريباً، قدم الآشوريين أول سلاح فرسان. الفرسان هني جيش بيقاتل على ضهور الخيل. ما كانوا اخترعوا السرج بعد، فقاتل الفرسان الآشوريون على ضهور خيولهم العارية.
mt: 1000 BC, Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. Cavalrymen were a mounted army that fought on horseback. They did not invent saddles until later, so Assyrian cavalry fought on bareback.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: بنى البابليون لكل واحد من آلهتهم معبد رئيسي، يلّي كان يُعتبر موطن للإله. كان الناس يقدموا القرابين للآلهة ويحاول الكهنة تلبية احتياجات الآلهة من خلال الاحتفالات والمهرجانات. كان لكل معبد ساحة معبد مفتوحة ومن بعدها ملاذ داخلي ما حدا في يفوت عليه إلا الكهنة. انبنت أبراج خاصة على شكل هرم بيسموها الزقورات أوقات لتكون جزء من المعابد. كان الجزء العلوي من البرج ملاذ خاص للرب.
mt: The Babylonians built a main temple for each of their gods, which was considered the god's home. People would offer sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to meet the gods' needs through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open courtyard and then an inner sanctuary where only the priests could go. Special towers in the shape of a pyramid were built, which they called ziggurats, and were part of the temples. The upper part of the tower was a special sanctuary for the god.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: "إيه مزبوط! يُعتبر الملك توت عنخ آمون اللي يُِسمى أوقات ""الملك توت"" أو ""الملك الصبي""، من أشهر الملوك المصريين القدماء بالعصر الحديث. ومن المثير للاهتمام أنه ما كان يعتبر كتير مهم بالعصور القديمة وما تم تسجيله بمعظم قوائم الملوك القديمة. فاكتشاف قبره سنة 1922 خلاه من المشاهير. بالوقت يلّي تم فيه نهب عدة مقابر قديمة، إلا أن هيدا القبر بقي متل منو. انحفظت معظم العناصر المدفونة مع توت عنخ آمون منيح، بما فيها آلاف القطع الأثرية المصنوعة من المعادن الثمينة والأحجار النادرة."
mt: "Wow! The boy king Tutankhamun, who is sometimes called "King Tut" or "the boy king," is one of the most famous ancient Egyptian kings. It is interesting to note that he was not considered very important in ancient times and was not listed in most ancient king lists. His discovery in 1922 made him famous. At the time, many ancient tombs were looted, but this tomb was left alone. Most of the objects buried with Tutankhamun were found intact, including thousands of precious metal and rare stone artifacts."
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: منعرف كتير علماء وسياسيين وممثليت يونانيين. وأكتر شخص مشهور منهم عالأغلب هو هومر، الشاعر الأعمى الأسطوري اللي ألّف ملاحم شعرية بالأدب اليوناني: إلياذة وأوديسا. سوفوكليس وأريستوفان من الكتاب المسرحيين بعدن مشهورين وبتعتبر مسرحياتهم من بين أعظم أعمال الأدب العالمي. عالم رياضيات فيثاغورس يوناني مشهور، معروف غالباً بنظريته الشهيرة حول العلاقات بين أضلاع المثلثات القائمة.
mt: Many Greek scientists and politicians are known. The most famous of them is Homer, the blind legendary poet who wrote epic poems in Greek: Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are well-known playwrights, and their plays are considered among the greatest works of world literature. Greek mathematician Pythagoras is known for his famous theory about the relationships between the sides of right triangles.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: بمناخ الشرق الأوسط الدافي، ما كان البيت كتير مهم. معظم حياة العيلة العبرية كانت تصير بالهواء الطلق. كانت السيدات بتطبخ بالساحة؛ وكانت المحلات مجرد مكان مفتوح بطل على الطريق وتم بناء البيوت باستعمال الحجر. ما كان في غابات كبيرة بأرض كنعان، لهيك كانت أسعار الخشب غالية.
mt: In the hot Middle Eastern climate, the house was very important. Most of the Israelite family's life was spent outdoors. Women cooked in the courtyard; shops were just an open stall on the road and houses were built with stone. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: بمناخ الشرق الأوسط الدافي، ما كان البيت كتير مهم. معظم حياة العيلة العبرية كانت تصير بالهواء الطلق. كانت السيدات بتطبخ بالساحة؛ وكانت المحلات مجرد مكان مفتوح بطل على الطريق وتم بناء البيوت باستعمال الحجر. ما كان في غابات كبيرة بأرض كنعان، لهيك كانت أسعار الخشب غالية.
mt: In the hot Middle Eastern climate, the house was very important. Most of the Israelite family's life was spent outdoors. Women cooked in the courtyard; shops were just an open stall on the road and houses were built with stone. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was expensive.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.

src: "استقرت غرينلاند بشكل منفصل. بالملاحم الإسكندنافية بقولوا إن إريك الأحمر نُفي من أيسلندا بتهمة القتل، وبس سافر على الغرب، لاقى جرينلاند وسمّاها جرينلاند. وبس بغض النظر عن اكتشافه، كانت قبائل الإسكيمو عايشة هون بالفعل بهيداك الوقت. مع إنو كل من الدينمارك والسويد والنرويج وإيسلندا كانوا بلدان ""إسكندنافية"" إلا إنو في كتير اختلافات بين شعوبهم وملوكهم وتاريخهم وتيابهم التقليدية."
mt: "Greenland was settled separately. The Scandinavian sagas say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and sailed west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. And regardless of his discovery, the Eskimo tribes had been living there at the time. While all of Denmark, Sweden, Norway, and Iceland were "Scandinavian" countries, there were many differences between their peoples and their kings and their traditional clothing."
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: بالرغم من إنو معظم أكل الرومان ممكن يكون مش غريب علينا، إلا إنو عندهم أكلات للعيد غريبة ومش عادية، متل الخنازير البرية والطاووس والبزاق ونوع من القوارض اسمه الزغبة. كان الاختلاف التاني هو أنه بينما كان الفقرا والنساء عم ياكلوا أكلهم جالسين على الكراسي، حبوا الرجال الأغنيا إقامة الولائم مع بعضهم مرتاحين على جانبهم بوقت تناولهم وجباتهم. ما ممكن تتضمن الوجبات الرومانية القديمة المأكولات يلّي اجت على أوروبا من أمريكا أو من آسيا بالقرون اللاحقة. مثلاً، ما كان عندهن درة، ولا بندورة، ولا بطاطا، ولا كاكاو، وما داقوا الرومان القدامى الديك الرومي أبداً.
mt: Although most Roman food may be familiar to us, they had some unusual holiday foods, such as wild boar, peacock, and pigeon. Another difference was that while the poor and women ate their meals sitting at tables, the rich men reclined on couches while eating. What Roman meals may have included foods that later came to Europe from America or Asia. For example, they did not have tomatoes, potatoes, or cocoa, and the ancient Romans never ate turkeys.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: "الحضارة هي ثقافة فردية مشتركة بين مجموعة كبيرة من الناس يلّي بعيشوا وبيشتغلوا بشكل تعاوني، مجتمع. وبتنشق كلمة حضارة من الكلمة اللاتينية civilis اللي بتعني مدني، والمتعلقة بكلمة civis اللاتنية واللي بتعني بدروها ""المواطن"". وبتعني كلمة civitas مدينة أو مدينة-دولة، وهيدا بيحدد بطريقة ما حجم المجتمع. دول المدن هي أسلاف الأمم. الثقافة الحضارية بتوحي بنقل المعرفة عبر عدة أجيال، وبصمة ثقافية باقية ونشر عادل. غالبًا ما بتبلش تختفي الثقافات الثانوية من دون ما تترك أدلة تاريخية ذات صلة وبتفشل بإنو يعترف فيها كحضارات مناسبة."
mt: "Civilization is a shared culture among a large group of people who live and work together, a society. The word civilization is derived from the Latin civilis, which means "civil", and is related to the Latin word civis, which means "citizen". The word civitas means "city" or "city-state", and in some way defines the size of the society. City-states are the ancestors of nations. Civilizational culture implies the transmission of knowledge across generations, a lasting cultural imprint, and equitable distribution. Civilizations often fail to recognize the existence of secondary cultures without leaving relevant historical evidence, and fail to recognize them as civilizations."
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: درغيول دونغ هي قلعة مدمرة ودير بوذي بالجزء العلوي من منطقة بارو بقرية فوندي. بقولوا أنه سنة 1649، أنشأ Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel القلعة لتخليد ذكرى انتصاره على القوات التبتية المنغولية. سنة 1951، ما ضل إلا بقايا قليلة من دروكيال دزونج بسبب حريق، متل صورة Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. بعد الحريق، تم الحفاظ على القلعة وحمايتها، وبقيت واحدة من أكتر معالم الجذب ببوتان.
mt: Drukgyel Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist temple in the upper part of the Paro valley in the village of Fongkha. It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel built the fortress to commemorate his victory over the Tibetan-Mongolian forces. In 1951, only a few remains of Drukgyel Dzong remained due to a fire, as seen in the picture of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, and remained one of the most popular tourist attractions in Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: بالقرن الـ18، لاقت كمبوديا حالها محاصرة بين جارتين قويتين، تايلاند وفيتنام. اجتاح الشعب التايلندي كمبوديا عدة مرات بالقرن التمنتعش. وبسنة 1772دمّروا فنوم فنين. بالسنين الأخيرة من القرن الـ18 غزا الفيتناميون كمبوديا كمان.
mt: 18th century, Cambodia was sandwiched between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thai people invaded Cambodia several times in the 19th century. In 1772, they destroyed Phnom Penh. In the last years of the 18th century, the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: بالقرن الـ18، لاقت كمبوديا حالها محاصرة بين جارتين قويتين، تايلاند وفيتنام. اجتاح الشعب التايلندي كمبوديا عدة مرات بالقرن التمنتعش. وبسنة 1772دمّروا فنوم فنين. بالسنين الأخيرة من القرن الـ18 غزا الفيتناميون كمبوديا كمان.

src: بلَّشت مدينة تايوان من القرن الـ15 فأطلقو البحّارة الأوروبيين على الجزيرة إسم Ilha Formosa، أو الجزيرة الحلوة. سنة 1624، أنشأت شركة الهند الشرقية الهولندية قاعدة بجنوب غرب تايوان، وبلَّشت التحول بإنتاج الحبوب الأصلية وتوظيف العمال الصينيين لليشتغلوا بمزارع الأرز والسكر. سنة 1683، سيطرت قوات أسرة تشينغ (1644-1912) على المناطق الساحلية الغربية والشمالية بتايوان وأعلنت تايوان كمقاطعة تابعة لإمبراطورية تشينغ سنة 1885. سنة 1895، بعد الهزيمة بالحرب الصينية اليابانية الأولى (1894-1895)، وقعت حكومة تشينغ على معاهدة شيمونوسيكي، يلّي بموجبها بتتنازل عن السيادة على تايوان لليابان، يلّي حكمت الجزيرة لحد سنة 1945.
mt: 15th century, Portuguese sailors named the island Ilha Formosa, or the beautiful island. In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan, and the transition was made by producing the original crops and employing Chinese workers to work in the rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, the Qing forces (1644-1912) took control of the western and northern coastal areas of Taiwan and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after the defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, under which it ceded sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: ويسمى هيدا المؤشر بالرقم الهيدروجيني وبتم الرمز له بـpH، وبتقدر تعمل مؤشر باستعمال عصير الملفوف الأحمر. بيتغير لون عصير الملفوف بالاعتماد على مدى حمضية أو قاعدية المادة الكيميائية. يُشار إلى مستوى الرقم الهيدروجيني PH بكمية أيونات الهيدروجين (H في PH) بالمادة الكيميائية المختبرة. أيونات الهيدروجين عبارة عن بروتونات خالية من إلكتروناتها (لأن بتتكون ذرات الهيدروجين من بروتون وإلكترون واحد).
mt: This indicator is called the pH, and is measured using red cabbage juice. The color of the red cabbage juice changes depending on the acidity or basicity of the chemical. The pH level of a chemical is measured by the amount of hydrogen ions (H in pH) in the chemical being tested. Hydrogen ions are protons that are missing their electrons (because they are made up of one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: الأسود أكتر قطط إجتماعية، وبتعيش بمجموعات كبيرة بيسموها القبيلة. بتتكون المجموعات من واحد لتلات ذكور بالغين، بالإضافة لتلاتين أنثى وشبل تقريباً. عادة بترتبط الإناث ارتباط وثيق ببعضهن، كونهن عيلة كبيرة من الأخوات والبنات. بتعيش قبيلة الأسود متل مجموعات الذئاب أو الكلاب تقريباً اللي هي حيوانات بتشبه بتصرفاتها كتير الأسود (بس مش القطط الكبيرة التانية)، وشرسة كتير على فرائسها.
mt: 1. Black cats are more social than other cats, and live in large groups called prides. Groups are usually made up of one to three adult males, plus about 13 females and cubs. Females are usually closely bonded to each other, as they are a large family of sisters and daughters. Prides live in groups like packs of wolves or dogs, which are similar to the behavior of the black cats (but not the other large cats), and are very fierce on their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: الأسود أكتر قطط إجتماعية، وبتعيش بمجموعات كبيرة بيسموها القبيلة. بتتكون المجموعات من واحد لتلات ذكور بالغين، بالإضافة لتلاتين أنثى وشبل تقريباً. عادة بترتبط الإناث ارتباط وثيق ببعضهن، كونهن عيلة كبيرة من الأخوات والبنات. بتعيش قبيلة الأسود متل مجموعات الذئاب أو الكلاب تقريباً اللي هي حيوانات بتشبه بتصرفاتها كتير الأسود (بس مش القطط الكبيرة التانية)، وشرسة كتير على فرائسها.

src: وفي تحتها بسينات متوسطة الحجم بتاكل فريسة متوسطة الحجم من الأرانب وصولا للضبي والغزلان. أخيرًا، في كتير قطط صغيرة (بما في ذلك القطط الأليفة السائبة) يلّي بتأكل الفرائس الصغيرة الأكتر عدد مثل الحشرات والقوارض والسحالي والطيور. سر نجاحهم هو البيئة الملائمة، وهي وظيفة خاصة لكل قطة بتمنعها من التنافس مع التانيين.
mt: 1. In the middle of the food chain, a medium-sized predator eats a medium-sized prey, such as rabbits, up to deer and antelopes. 2. Finally, many small cats (including feral cats) eat small prey in greater numbers, such as insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. Their success is the suitable environment, a special function of each cat that prevents them from competing with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: وفي تحتها بسينات متوسطة الحجم بتاكل فريسة متوسطة الحجم من الأرانب وصولا للضبي والغزلان. أخيرًا، في كتير قطط صغيرة (بما في ذلك القطط الأليفة السائبة) يلّي بتأكل الفرائس الصغيرة الأكتر عدد مثل الحشرات والقوارض والسحالي والطيور. سر نجاحهم هو البيئة الملائمة، وهي وظيفة خاصة لكل قطة بتمنعها من التنافس مع التانيين.
